Title: Product Analyst (Quick Commerce)
Description:
As the world‚Äôs pioneering local delivery platform, our mission is to deliver an amazing experience, fast, easy, and to your door. We operate in over 70+ countries worldwide, powered by tech, designed by people. As one of Europe‚Äôs largest tech platforms, headquartered in Berlin, Germany. Delivery Hero has been listed on the Frankfurt Stock Exchange since 2017 and is part of the MDAX stock market index. We enable creative minds to deliver solutions that create impact within our ecosystem. We move fast, take action and adapt. No matter where you're from or what you believe in, we build, we deliver, we lead. We are Delivery Hero.

Job Description

We are on the lookout for a Product Analyst to join the Quick Commerce Product Analytics team on our journey to always deliver amazing experiences.

Be part of redefining how customers experience quick commerce. You‚Äôll help build technology that scales our non-food offerings, reaching new market segments and driving revenue growth. By innovating within our Quick Commerce Team, you‚Äôll make Delivery Hero the go-to platform for a broad range of products, helping us grow faster and deliver more value to customers around the world.

You will play a pivotal role in redefining how we leverage data to optimize our quick commerce offerings, directly impacting our ability to scale and grow our DMarts and Local Shops segments. By driving data-driven insights within our Quick Commerce Product Analytics Team, you'll help empower product decisions and ensure our initiatives deliver tangible business value.

You'll partner closely with Product Managers, driving operational excellence and strategic insights across Fulfillment Operations, Supply Chain, Assortment, Pricing, and Integrations. Focusing on metrics monitoring ,deep dive analysis, experimentation, feature reporting, pipeline building and fostering a data-driven culture.

Your insights will directly shape product roadmaps, optimize features, and assess impact. You will define KPIs, design experiments, and communicate findings to senior stakeholders. You'll help us ensure product initiatives deliver measurable business value, transitioning from a reporting mindset to a problem-solving approach. Your work will directly impact our ability to scale and grow our non-food offerings.


Collaborate with Product Managers and cross-functional teams to define KPIs, track performance, and support product decision-making
Conduct exploratory and descriptive analyses of product usage and adoption patterns to identify insights and improvement opportunities
Support analytics needs across product initiatives, including dashboard development and data pulls
Design and execute experiments(A/B, Quasi-experiment) to optimize product features and user experience
Support the implementation of tracking strategies and ensure data integrity
Generate business intelligence solutions and compelling visualizations to communicate key insights


Qualifications


2‚Äì4 years of experience in Product Analytics, Data Analytics, or a similar role, ideally within a digital or product-driven environment
Strong analytical thinking and a willingness to learn more advanced statistical and experimental techniques
Proficient in writing complex SQL and practical experience using Python (or similar) for data manipulation and exploratory analysis as well as expertise in data visualization tools such as Tableau, Looker Studio, or similar
Hands-on experience running A/B tests and analyzing results, with a solid understanding of experimentation fundamentals and a desire to deepen expertise
Familiarity with web or app tracking tools (e.g., Mixpanel, Amplitude, Segment, GA)
Ability to interpret data and communicate findings in a clear, concise, and actionable way


Additional Information

Ensuring you and all our Heroes are looked after, happy, and healthy is always on the menu. Because if you‚Äôre in good shape, then we‚Äôre in good shape.


Make the most of our hybrid working model and join the team for face-to-face connection and collaboration in our beautiful Berlin campus 2 days a week
We offer 27 days holiday with an extra day on 2nd and 3rd year of service
We will support you in developing yourself and your career growth opportunities: 1.000 ‚Ç¨ Educational Budget, Language Courses, Parental Support and access to the Udemy Business platform to explore a variety of online courses.
Get moving and release those wonderful, mind-boosting endorphins: Health Checkups, Meditation, Yoga, Gym & Bicycle Subsidy
Cash. Dough. Cheddar. Whatever you call it, we‚Äôll help you with it: Employee Share Purchase Plan, Sabbatical Bank, Public Transportation Ticket Discount, Life & Accident Insurance, Corporate Pension Plan
The power of getting together over some food is unrivaled. Here are a few ways to help you do that. All the yum: Digital Meal Vouchers, Food Vouchers, Corporate Discounts. Courses.


Ready to join our team?

If you‚Äôre excited to grow, collaborate, and be part of the world‚Äôs leading delivery platform, we‚Äôd love to hear from you. Apply today!

We believe diversity and inclusion are key to creating not only an exciting product, but also an amazing customer and employee experience. Fostering this starts with hiring - therefore we do not discriminate on the basis of racial identities, religious beliefs, color, national origin, gender identities or expressions, sexual orientations, age, marital or disability statuses, or any other aspect that makes you, you. Title: Lead Data Strategist (BI & Analytics) (m/f/d)
Description:
About getolo:

Founded in 2015, getolo GmbH is an innovative and award-winning InsurTech company that offers comprehensive supplementary insurance plans in the areas of dental, pet health and liability, as well as health add-on coverage. Under the brands dentolo, petolo, and vitolo, we serve over 200,000 customers in Germany and France, providing digital and hassle-free protection that seamlessly integrates into their daily lives.

We believe that prevention is always better than cure‚Äîwhich is why we focus on preventive care, customer-centric service, and financial security to protect our customers and their loved ones from unexpected costs. Thanks to the close collaboration of our team of market specialists and insurance experts, we continuously monitor industry developments to offer practical solutions for current challenges.

getolo's company culture is built on collaboration, innovation, and agility‚Äîalways with a strong focus on the needs of our customers. With a team of around 200 employees, getolo is led by Daniel Gadea (CEO) and Laura Wulff (CGO). getolo is a partner of DA Direkt and part of the Zurich Group Germany.

We are seeking a strategic and results-driven Lead Data Strategist (BI & Analytics) (m/f/d) to define and drive a company-wide reporting and dashboarding strategy that focuses on actionable insights. Are you ready for a new challenge in a rapidly developing insurtech? Look no further‚ò∫Ô∏è

Your role in a team:

BI & Reporting Strategy


Define and drive a company-wide reporting and dashboarding strategy that focuses on actionable insights
Support in maintaining and developing our self-service landscape and improve data literacy across our company
Identify and eliminate redundant or low-impact reports; streamline and standardize KPI definitions across teams


Business Prioritization & Data Strategy


Act as a sparring partner to the Data Platform Lead to prioritize data sources and models based on business needs and strategic goals
Translate business requirements into clear data needs and help shape the data roadmap
Ensure alignment between data infrastructure and use cases across departments


Analytics Enablement & Coaching


Mentor and upskill Business Analysts in Sales, Marketing, and Ops, helping them grow their analytical capabilities and storytelling with data
Create best practices for dashboard creation, metric consistency, and interpretation of results
Facilitate a knowledge-sharing culture across analysts and ensure alignment in tooling and methodology


Strategic Data Projects


Enabling leadership with data-driven insights (e.g. customer segmentation, growth modeling, churn analysis)
Serve as a strategic advisor to the Management and leadership team on critical business questions, using data to guide high-impact decisions
Lead cross-functional, strategic initiatives like integrating new markets into our reporting landscape or supporting pricing and product analytics for new insurance products


What you need to be successful:


5-8 years of experience in analytics, business intelligence, or data strategy roles ‚Äî ideally in high-growth tech, SaaS, or digital business environments
Proven track record of owning company-wide reporting or BI initiatives, including defining KPI frameworks and improving dashboard ecosystems
Experience working closely with leadership or C-level on strategic, data-driven decisions (e.g., pricing, market expansion, customer segmentation)
Strong ability to translate business questions into data needs, and partner with data engineering or platform teams on model requirements
Hands-on experience with modern BI tools (e.g., Looker, Metabase, Tableau, Power BI) and SQL proficiency for self-service analytics
Prior mentoring or informal leadership of analysts or cross-functional stakeholders; ideally experience establishing analytics standards or processes
Familiarity with data governance, definitions, and source documentation, even if not responsible for pipelines or ETL
Bonus: exposure to insurance, healthtech, or regulated environments, or experience supporting pricing and underwriting teams
dbt knowledge would be a plus
Native or C2 English, German would be a plus
Berlin-based


Why getolo?

üå¥ Salary & Vacation


Attractive fixed salary
Start with 28 vacation days, with an increase every two years (capped at 30 days). Holidays on December 24th and 31st. 2 community days to support a charity organisation of your choice


üßë‚Äçüíª Mobility & Flexibility


Choose between a free Swapfiets bike, a BVG ticket ("Umweltticket") or a "Deutschlandticket" subsidized by us
Work hybrid - from your home office or in our office in Berlin-Mitte
Work abroad in the EU for up to 60 days


üßò Health


Benefit from free coaching sessions with nilo.health, our mental health tool
Test our products yourself! Choose between dentolo, petolo or vitolo


üìö Development


Training budget starting from 750 ‚Ç¨ per year
Regular (360 degree) feedback


üôå And much more...


Legendary summer and winter parties
Regular team events
Many discounts on the corporate Benefits Platform
Pet friendly office


Sounds like the perfect job for you? We look forward to receiving your application and getting to know you!

getolo is an equal opportunity and diversity employer. We strive to create a friendly, safe, and welcoming environment for all our team members, regardless of ethnicity, gender, gender identity and expression, sexual orientation, limitations and talents of any kind, physical appearance, social background, marital status, age, or religion (or lack thereof).

When you apply, we focus solely on your experience and motivation. You decide what additional information you want to disclose (photo, marital status, religion, gender, nationality, etc.). We value and treat all applications equally.

Contact:

Katia Minukhina

Talent Acquisition Manager

jobs@getolo.com

030398200588

Title: Staff Product Analyst, Adtech
Description:
As the world‚Äôs pioneering local delivery platform, our mission is to deliver an amazing experience, fast, easy, and to your door. We operate in over 70+ countries worldwide, powered by tech, designed by people. As one of Europe‚Äôs largest tech platforms, headquartered in Berlin, Germany. Delivery Hero has been listed on the Frankfurt Stock Exchange since 2017 and is part of the MDAX stock market index. We enable creative minds to deliver solutions that create impact within our ecosystem. We move fast, take action and adapt. No matter where you're from or what you believe in, we build, we deliver, we lead. We are Delivery Hero.

Job Description

We are on the lookout for a Staff Product Analyst to join the Adtech tribe on our journey to always deliver amazing experiences.

We work on developing digital advertising solutions for our vendors. Currently, these solutions are available on our food ordering platform, both on mobile and the web. The Ad Tech solutions support the vendors in all three steps of the marketing funnel: awareness, consideration, and conversion enabling them to achieve sustainable growth on our platform.

A Product Analyst in the Ad Tech organization plays a pivotal role in enabling data-driven decision-making. You will have end-to-end ownership of data: define and implement tracking requirements, set up A/B tests, analyze large datasets to provide actionable insights on the performance of different revenue streams, and communicate the results to relevant stakeholders.

You will be a critical member in defining the product strategy and the continued success of our brands.

If you're a creative problem solver who is hungry for a new adventure, an international workplace is waiting for you in the heart of Berlin!


Drive data mindset in the team, guide in terms of methodology, support and execute testing, and be a quality gatekeeper on data leading to product decisions
Develop in-depth analytical understanding for what drives growth for the product and how it can be improved
Leverage insights from data by providing analyses, reports and dashboards for product management and other departments
Use quantitative analysis and the presentation of data to see beyond the numbers and understand what drives our business, providing insights to help product managers, designers, and engineers to decide which features to build and why
Work with structured and semi-structured data from different data sources and different products


Qualifications


Overall 6+ years of experience, preferably in e-commerce
You've completed a degree in statistics, mathematics, economics, computer science or an equivalent education or possess relevant practical experience
Very good communication skills in English, both written and oral
Data Analysis: Strong experience in SQL (BigQuery) and Python (alternatively R)
A/B Testing: Experience designing experiments and analyzing results with a solid background in statistics
Data Visualization Technologies: Preferably Tableau or similar alternatives e.g. Looker, QlikView, etc.


Nice to have:


Tracking Technologies: Google Analytics or similar alternatives e.g. Adobe Analytics/Omniture, SnowPlow, etc.

HTML:
As the world‚Äôs pioneering local delivery platform, our mission is to deliver an amazing experience, fast, easy, and to your door. We operate in over 70+ countries worldwide, powered by tech, designed by people. As one of Europe‚Äôs largest tech platforms, headquartered in Berlin, Germany. Delivery Hero has been listed on the Frankfurt Stock Exchange since 2017 and is part of the MDAX stock market index. We enable creative minds to deliver solutions that create impact within our ecosystem. We move fast, take action and adapt. No matter where you're from or what you believe in, we build, we deliver, we lead. We are Delivery Hero.

Job Description

We are on the lookout for a Staff Product Analyst to join the Adtech tribe on our journey to always deliver amazing experiences.

We work on developing digital advertising solutions for our vendors. Currently, these solutions are available on our food ordering platform, both on mobile and the web. The Ad Tech solutions support the vendors in all three steps of the marketing funnel: awareness, consideration, and conversion enabling them to achieve sustainable growth on our platform.

A Product Analyst in the Ad Tech organization plays a pivotal role in enabling data-driven decision-making. You will have end-to-end ownership of data: define and implement tracking requirements, set up A/B tests, analyze large datasets to provide actionable insights on the performance of different revenue streams, and communicate the results to relevant stakeholders.

You will be a critical member in defining the product strategy and the continued success of our brands.

If you're a creative problem solver who is hungry for a new adventure, an international workplace is waiting for you in the heart of Berlin!

  • Drive data mindset in the team, guide in terms of methodology, support and execute testing, and be a quality gatekeeper on data leading to product decisions
  • Develop in-depth analytical understanding for what drives growth for the product and how it can be improved
  • Leverage insights from data by providing analyses, reports and dashboards for product management and other departments
  • Use quantitative analysis and the presentation of data to see beyond the numbers and understand what drives our business, providing insights to help product managers, designers, and engineers to decide which features to build and why
  • Work with structured and semi-structured data from different data sources and different products

Qualifications

  • Overall 6+ years of experience, preferably in e-commerce
  • You've completed a degree in statistics, mathematics, economics, computer science or an equivalent education or possess relevant practical experience
  • Very good communication skills in English, both written and oral
  • Data Analysis: Strong experience in SQL (BigQuery) and Python (alternatively R)
  • A/B Testing: Experience designing experiments and analyzing results with a solid background in statistics
  • Data Visualization Technologies: Preferably Tableau or similar alternatives e.g. Looker, QlikView, etc.

Nice to have:

  • Tracking Technologies: Google Analytics or similar alternatives e.g. Adobe Analytics/Omniture, SnowPlow, etc.
  • Industry expertise in advertising and/or marketing.

Additional Information

Ensuring you and all our Heroes are looked after, happy, and healthy is always on the menu. Because if you‚Äôre in good shape, then we‚Äôre in good shape.

  • Make the most of our hybrid working model and join the team for face-to-face connection and collaboration in our beautiful Berlin campus 2 days a week
  • We offer 27 days holiday with an extra day on 2nd and 3rd year of service
  • We will support you in developing yourself and your career growth opportunities: 1.000 ‚Ç¨ Educational Budget, Language Courses, Parental Support and access to the Udemy Business platform to explore a variety of online courses.
  • Get moving and release those wonderful, mind-boosting endorphins: Health Checkups, Meditation, Yoga, Gym & Bicycle Subsidy
  • Cash. Dough. Cheddar. Whatever you call it, we‚Äôll help you with it: Employee Share Purchase Plan, Sabbatical Bank, Public Transportation Ticket Discount, Life & Accident Insurance, Corporate Pension Plan
  • The power of getting together over some food is unrivaled. Here are a few ways to help you do that. All the yum: Digital Meal Vouchers, Food Vouchers, Corporate Discounts. Courses.

Ready to join our team? If you‚Äôre excited to grow, collaborate and be part of the world‚Äôs leading delivery platform, we‚Äôd love to hear from you. Apply today!

Title: Staff Data Analyst, Marketing Analytics
Description:
Change the way the world travels

Be part of the GetYourGuide journey and connect people with unforgettable travel experiences worldwide. Since 2009, millions of travelers have booked unique activities with us in over 12,000 cities. Our headquarters in Berlin is supported by 16 other local offices across the globe.

Ready to join a diverse community of over 850 fellow explorers dedicated to revolutionizing the travel experience industry? Visit our careers website to learn more.

Team mission

The Analytics department‚Äôs mission is to enable the Marketing organisation to take action based on data. We work on a variety of problems and datasets as members of cross-functional mission teams. We take ownership of the entire analytics funnel, from exploration through recommendations to impact measurement, and take pride in the insights we generate.

This specific position is within our Marketing Analytics team whose objective is to help our marketing scale our investments towards the most incremental and loyal customers. This is a very strategic position within the team as the Analyst will look at solving cross-channel problems in order to accelerate our growth. This means for example addressing the best strategy to grow our mid-funnel spend and understanding the behaviour of our repeat audiences.

Your mission


Develop quantitative analysis and statistical models to evaluate and steer marketing decisions
Propose and defend strategic recommendations to our top marketing leads
Maintain and improve our marketing measurement tools (Attribution, experimentation framework, Customer lifetime value‚Ä¶)
Explore large datasets, give meaning to data and numbers, identify opportunities and issues, and present findings to stakeholders
Setup and analyse marketing experiments to drive strategic decision making
Serve as a liaison between the marketing teams and the data engineering team
Mentor others in the skills needed for this role


Your toolkit


8+ years of relevant experience interpreting data in an analytics, data science or business intelligence role
Strong knowledge of SQL and Python for analysis (eg, pandas, scikit-learn, pyspark)
Ability to understand user behavior and meaning behind the numbers and a track record in sharing insights to business stakeholders
Prior exposure to digital and performance marketing, especially data-driven platforms such as Google Ads and Meta.
Experience with data visualization and reporting tools (e.g. Looker, Jupyter Notebooks, Databricks)
Desire to work in an international environment, with minimal direction and with highly engaged individuals
Excellent written and verbal communication skills in English


What Sets You Apart


A track record in solving marketing and growth challenges and influencing decisions/driving business results
Experience in understanding and modelling marketing journeys
Experience with big data tools (e.g. Spark, Hive) is a plus


We want your journey with us to be extraordinary


Here‚Äôs how you can expect us to commit to you and your growth.
Annual personal growth budget and mentorship programs for continuous learning and development
Work from anywhere in the world for 40 days per year
Flexible working arrangements to support work-life balance
Opportunities to collaborate and socialize with team members through quarterly team events and yearly company-wide events
Monthly transportation and fitness budget
Discounts for you, your friends, and family on GetYourGuide activities
Language reimbursement program
Health and wellness benefits


And more‚Ä¶

How to apply

Submit your CV/resume in English using the form below. For tips and insights into our hiring process and culture, check out ‚Äòhow we hire‚Äô and ‚Äòlife at GetYourGuide‚Äô. If you have any further questions, please don‚Äôt hesitate to get in touch at jobs@getyourguide.com.

We are an equal opportunity employer

Our commitment is that every qualified person will be evaluated according to skills regardless of age, gender identity, ethnicity, sexual orientation, disability status, or religion. Please refrain from including your picture and age with the application.

Title: Business Intelligence Analyst (m/f/d)
Description:
As a Business Intelligence Analyst (m/f/d) in the Global Digital Marketing & Sales Operations Team, you will be primarily responsible for generating and preparing data-driven insights for our marketing, service, and sales activities. By aggregating, analyzing, and visualizing data from various sources, you will play a key role in optimizing our customer journey, enhancing the efficiency of our marketing and lead generation campaigns, improving call center management processes, and supporting strategic decision-making.

Your impact


Conducting customer journey analyses using Global Digital Marketing data to identify trends and derive actionable recommendations.
Developing, maintaining, and optimizing dashboards and reports in Power BI and Google Sheets for KPI visualization and monitoring.
Automating and optimizing data processes while ensuring data quality using Python, SQL, and Databricks.
Supporting central and global marketing teams with planning, forecasting, and ongoing monitoring of their target KPIs.
Creating country-specific analyses to drive growth and optimize the use of digital marketing channels in individual markets.
Collaborating closely with the Data Engineering and Data Science teams within Viessmann IT.
Preparing results in the form of presentations, reports, and summaries for relevant stakeholders.


Who you are


A completed degree in business administration, economics, data science, or a comparable analytical field.
Several years of professional experience in business intelligence, data analytics, CRM, or a similar analytical area.
Strong analytical skills and knowledge of statistics and data modeling.
Extensive experience with tools like Power BI, Google Data Studio, Databricks, and ideally Python, SQL, or similar technologies.
Experience in analyzing CRM, call center, and/or performance marketing data.
Ability to effectively prepare and present complex data in an understandable and impactful way.
Independent, structured working style and enjoyment of working in an international, cross-functional team.
Language skills in German and English (at least Level C1).


Even if you don't fulfill all of the above but are ready to take this challenge on as a next step, go ahead and press ‚ÄúApply‚Äù anyway. We love your spirit!

What makes us special

Our employees are the key to make our vision come alive. With that in mind, we‚Äòve created a range of perks for our employees:


A permanent position awaits you at our business where new technologies meet a modern workplace culture.
Viessmann Climate Solutions offers 30 days of paid vacation a year.
Once you join Viessmann, you can refer other great candidates and receive a referral bonus if they are hired.
Enjoy cool exclusive discounts on selected Viessmann Climate Solutions products and services.
Need a quick energy boost? Free healthy snacks and drinks are provided for you.
For a healthier community: Our health program offers easy access to coaching and therapy for our employees and their families.
Whether commuting by Job Bike or travelling by Europcar - our partnerships will protect the environment and your wallet.
The Viessmann academy and external partners offer a wide range of professional and personal training opportunities.
Whenever possible, Viessmann offers the option of mobile working and also provides the needed technical equipment.
Celebrate and have a great time with your co-workers at our individualized events, like our monthly breakfast or other team events.
Our flexible working hours allow you to balance your work and private life.
Daycare center or school closed? No problem! Your child will find toys and enough space to play-- and you have a fully equipped workplace to work in our child-parent room.


Who we are

We are Viessmann Climate Solutions. Founded in 1917 as a heating technology manufacturer, and now part of Carrier, we are today one of the world's leading providers of efficient and systemic climate and renewable energy solutions. We cover all applications: heating, cooling, ventilation, water and air quality, energy generation, and energy storage for the residential and commercial sector.

Our integrated solution offering seamlessly connects products and systems via digital platforms and services to a holistic climate and energy solution, thus creating a safe and reliable feel-good climate for our users. All activities are driven by our company purpose, "We create living spaces for generations to come" and our employees are passionate about playing an active role in the energy transition. Join us on this exciting journey now.
Show more

Title: Senior Data Analyst (all genders)
Description:
About This Position

Are you passionate about turning raw data into strategic insights that drive business success? Do you thrive in a fast-paced startup environment where you have the autonomy to shape and scale data infrastructure?

They heyData is your next stop!

As a Senior Data Analyst, you will play a crucial role in managing our data infrastructure, developing scalable data models, and providing actionable insights to teams across the company. You'll ensure data-driven decision-making and foster a data-first culture.

Your mission


Manage & Optimize BI Infrastructure: Own and maintain our end-to-end BI setup, which currently includes Airbyte, dbt, Snowflake, and Metabase. Continuously evaluate and implement the best tools to meet our evolving needs.
Develop Scalable Data Models: Build and maintain reliable, scalable data models that ensure data integrity and accuracy across all business functions.
Drive Strategic Insights: Analyze business performance metrics, identify trends, and provide actionable recommendations to leadership and various teams.
Cross-Team Collaboration: Work closely with engineering, product, marketing, and sales teams to understand data needs and support data-driven decision-making.
Mentorship & Alignment: Manage and upskill junior team members and ensure that data strategies align with the company‚Äôs vision and goals.
Ensure Data Governance: Implement and uphold data governance policies and industry best practices to maintain compliance and security.


What we are looking for?


5+ years of experience in Business Intelligence, Data Analytics, or a related field.Strong proficiency in SQL and experience working with relational databases (PostgreSQL, Snowflake, Redshift, etc.).
Hands-on experience with BI tools such as Tableau, Power BI, Metabase, or similar.
Knowledge of data modeling, ETL processes, and data warehousing concepts.
Strong analytical and problem-solving skills, with the ability to translate data into meaningful business insights.
Excellent communication skills, with the ability to present complex data clearly to non-technical stakeholders.
Experience with dbt is a plus.
Good knowledge of Python or R for data analysis is a plus.
Experience in a startup or fast-paced environment is a plus.


Why heyData?


Your growth matters: Clear development paths, an annual & flexible learning budget, and real trust in your ideas.
Work the way that works for you: Remote, from our Berlin office, or hybrid - you decide where you‚Äôre most productive.
Time for yourself: 30 vacation days, flexible working hours, and a work culture that values focus time and supports your productivity.
State-of-the-art equipment : A MacBook & Co. to help you get started quickly
On top of that, we support in your Benefits: Urban Sports Club membership, the Deutschlandticket, a company pension plan, and more.
Team spirit that sticks: Offsites, regular team events, and honest, transparent communication on equal footing.
Be yourself: Diversity makes us stronger ‚Äì no matter where you‚Äôre from, how you identify, or where you are in life.


About Us

At heyData, we are determined to serve our mission: making Compliance easy for everybody!

At heyData, we're not just a company; we're a movement. We're reshaping the way small and medium-sized businesses embrace compliance. We set up European employees on track to reach compliance in the fastest, most intuitive, and seamless way possible. Think of us as the superheroes of compliance, and we've only just begun. With over one thousand customers we are one of the largest SMB compliance platforms in Europe and are expanding further.

But here's the real kicker ‚Äì you get to learn from a world-class team across Europe and contribute to a game-changing compliance solution that's set to revolutionize millions of SMBs. So, are you ready to be part of this incredible journey and do the most exciting work of your life? Let's make compliance history together! #heyDataLife

If the idea of making an impact excites you as much as it does us, then heyData is where you belong. This is your chance to leap into the adventure of a lifetime and set your career on fire! Reach out to us, and let's blaze a trail together in the world of business innovation! #JoinheyData

At heyData, we're proud to be a vibrant and diverse startup. We celebrate and embrace people from all backgrounds, including diverse gender, age, sexuality, religion, ethnicity, disability status parental status, and more to apply to our roles. Our team thrives on the unique perspectives and experiences that each person brings. We're committed to fostering an inclusive and supportive environment where everyone can succeed. The more diverse and inclusive we are as a team, the greater our work will be.
Show more

Title: Staff Product Analyst - Consumer Product
Description:
As the world‚Äôs pioneering local delivery platform, our mission is to deliver an amazing experience, fast, easy, and to your door. We operate in over 70+ countries worldwide, powered by tech, designed by people. As one of Europe‚Äôs largest tech platforms, headquartered in Berlin, Germany. Delivery Hero has been listed on the Frankfurt Stock Exchange since 2017 and is part of the MDAX stock market index. We enable creative minds to deliver solutions that create impact within our ecosystem. We move fast, take action and adapt. No matter where you're from or what you believe in, we build, we deliver, we lead. We are Delivery Hero.

Job Description

We are on the lookout for a Staff Product Analyst to join the Consumer Product Analytics team on our journey to always deliver amazing experiences.

At Delivery Hero, you‚Äôll shape the global consumer experience for millions of users. Your work will have a direct impact on how we attract and retain customers, creating data-driven, personalized interactions that keep them coming back. As part of our Consumer Team, you‚Äôll enhance customer satisfaction and drive global growth and profitability through innovative projects.

The Consumer Product Analytics Team drives product strategy and innovation by providing actionable insights on customers and products, contributing to business success. In this role, you'll have the opportunity to shape the experience for millions of users across our worldwide portfolio of platforms (FoodPanda, Pedidos Ya, Woowa, Yemeksepeti, Foodora, Talabat, HungerStation, eFood, and Glovo), directly impacting customer satisfaction and driving growth. Our diverse team of data professionals is based in Berlin, working closely with product directors, product managers, engineers, and business stakeholders to directly influence product direction. We collaborate with a larger data team, including data engineers, data scientists, and ML engineers, to share knowledge and expertise.

At Consumer Product Analytics, you will have the opportunity to access high volume, rich user behavior data, engage in end to end product development cycles, work on complex product problems, and learn from many experienced data professionals.

The main responsibilities of the Product Analytics Team include:


Strategic Impact & Product Leadership: Act as a key strategic data partner to product leadership, influencing product roadmap and investment decisions through deep analytical insights and foresight. Proactively identify high-impact analytical opportunities to drive significant customer satisfaction and business growth.
Advanced Experimentation & Causal Inference: Design, implement, and rigorously analyze A/B tests and other experimental designs (e.g., multi-variate, quasi-experiments) with a strong emphasis on advanced statistical methods for robust hypothesis validation, accurate impact measurement, and understanding causal relationships. Drive the standardization and continuous improvement of our experimentation framework across multiple brands.
Metric Framework & OKR Ownership: Define, establish, and own comprehensive product metric frameworks and quarterly OKRs. Drive alignment on "what good looks like" across product teams, ensuring clear, measurable goals that align with strategic business outcomes.
Data Integrity & Tracking Excellence: Take ownership of tracking definition and work closely with various Delivery Hero brands to significantly improve the reliability, consistency, and completeness of user behavior tracking for our discovery tools. Proactively identify and resolve data quality issues at scale.
Scalable ETL & Reporting Solutions: Design, build, and maintain robust data pipelines and self-service dashboards, ensuring data accessibility and empowering product teams to make data-driven decisions independently.
Deep Dive & Exploratory Analysis: Conduct complex, end-to-end exploratory analyses on large-scale user behavior data (transactional, clickstream, etc.) to uncover non-obvious insights, identify root causes of trends, and directly inform product strategy and roadmap development.
Technical & Mentorship Leadership: Contribute significantly to the growth and development of fellow product analysts through knowledge sharing sessions, best practice dissemination, workflow optimizations, and active participation in hiring and onboarding processes. Champion and drive analytical excellence within the team and broader organization.


Qualifications


9+ years of experience in product analytics or a related data-focused role, preferably within rapidly growing and dynamic environments, and with a broad mission scope or multiple stakeholders.
Experience working in Search & Recommendations systems.
Expert proficiency in SQL and Python for complex data manipulation, analysis, and modeling. Experience with BigQuery and large-scale cloud data warehousing concepts is a strong plus.
Expertise in statistical methods applied to experimental design (A/B testing, multivariate tests, etc.), causal inference, and robust hypothesis validation. You should be able to navigate complex statistical challenges and explain methodologies clearly.
Extensive experience working with large-scale user behavior data (e.g., transactional, clickstream, app usage), including data cleaning, transformation, and analysis to derive actionable insights.
Proficiency with at least one data visualization tool such as Looker Studio (Data Studio), Tableau, QlikView, or Power BI, with a proven ability to create compelling and insightful dashboards.
Demonstrated ability to influence and collaborate with multiple stakeholders, including senior product managers, engineers, and business leaders. You can clearly communicate complex analytical findings and successfully drive large-scale analytics projects end-to-end (e.g., defining success metrics for a tribe, standardizing measurement across brands, or implementing new experimentation methodologies).
Experience with customer behavior tracking platforms (e.g., Google Analytics, Adobe Analytics, MixPanel, Snowplow, Segment, Tealium).


Nice to have:


Experience with Airflow, DBT, or other data pipelining tools
Familiarity with recommender systems, ML models, or ranking algorithms
Experience scaling analytics processes or experimentation programs across multiple teams or brands.


Additional Information

Ensuring you and all our Heroes are looked after, happy, and healthy is always on the menu. Because if you‚Äôre in good shape, then we‚Äôre in good shape.


Make the most of our hybrid working model and join the team for face-to-face connection and collaboration in our beautiful Berlin campus 2 days a week
We offer 27 days holiday with an extra day on 2nd and 3rd year of service
We will support you in developing yourself and your career growth opportunities: 1.000 ‚Ç¨ Educational Budget, Language Courses, Parental Support and access to the Udemy Business platform to explore a variety of online courses.
Get moving and release those wonderful, mind-boosting endorphins: Health Checkups, Meditation, Yoga, Gym & Bicycle Subsidy
Cash. Dough. Cheddar. Whatever you call it, we‚Äôll help you with it: Employee Share Purchase Plan, Sabbatical Bank, Public Transportation Ticket Discount, Life & Accident Insurance, Corporate Pension Plan
The power of getting together over some food is unrivaled. Here are a few ways to help you do that. All the yum: Digital Meal Vouchers, Food Vouchers, Corporate Discounts. Courses.


Ready to join our team? If you‚Äôre excited to grow, collaborate and be part of the world‚Äôs leading delivery platform, we‚Äôd love to hear from you. Apply today!

We believe diversity and inclusion are key to creating not only an exciting product, but also an amazing customer and employee experience. Fostering this starts with hiring - therefore we do not discriminate on the basis of racial identities, religious beliefs, color, national origin, gender identities or expressions, sexual orientations, age, marital or disability statuses, or any other aspect that makes you, you. We encourage you to let us know if you need any accommodations or specific accessibility support to ensure a smooth interview experience‚Äîjust include it in your application. You're welcome to share your pronouns (he/she/they) right from the start so we can address you respectfully from our first contact.

Title: Staff Product Analyst - (Logistics)
Description:
As the world‚Äôs pioneering local delivery platform, our mission is to deliver an amazing experience, fast, easy, and to your door. We operate in over 70+ countries worldwide, powered by tech, designed by people. As one of Europe‚Äôs largest tech platforms, headquartered in Berlin, Germany. Delivery Hero has been listed on the Frankfurt Stock Exchange since 2017 and is part of the MDAX stock market index. We enable creative minds to deliver solutions that create impact within our ecosystem. We move fast, take action and adapt. No matter where you're from or what you believe in, we build, we deliver, we lead. We are Delivery Hero.

Job Description

We are on the lookout for a Staff Product Analyst - (Logistics) to join our Analytics team and shape the future of data strategy, experimentation, and impact at Delivery Hero.

In Logistics, we build products and shape processes towards an amazing delivery experience for our customers, riders, and service. In the Analytics team, we curate data to uncover insights, enable self-service discovery, and drive the strategic development of Logistics functions. Being embedded in the Product Line, we foster the ‚Äúdata-first‚Äù mindset and drive change in product development.

As a Staff Product Analyst, you‚Äôll work across multiple squads, domains, and functions within a tribe to drive end-to-end analytics excellence. You‚Äôll partner with stakeholders in Product, Tech, and Data to build impactful solutions, mentor colleagues, and help define the strategic direction of analytics across the organization. You will not only bring deep technical and business expertise to your tribe, but also champion innovation, collaboration, and quality at scale.

This is your opportunity to join a passionate, high-impact team and influence how we use data to make decisions that shape the future of local delivery.

Your mission:


Own problem-solving and solution design for highly complex business and technical challenges, balancing speed and quality.
Align product analytics lifecycle practices with business goals ‚Äì from scoping and data tracking design to data curation, analysis, visualization, and stakeholder alignment.
Lead experimentation strategy and execution across squads, guiding engineering and data science partners on implementation, tracking, and interpretation.
Define and maintain domain- and tribe-level metrics and KPIs, and ensure adoption of scalable, insightful dashboards.
Drive forward scalable analytics infrastructure, build technical capabilities, and set standards for data quality and insight generation.
Provide guidance and mentorship to other analysts, fostering a culture of knowledge-sharing and technical excellence.


Qualifications


6+ years of experience as a Product Analyst, Data Analyst, Data Scientist or similar role, preferably in fast-paced tech or internet companies.
Proven ability to lead technically complex and high-impact projects with autonomy.
Expert SQL skills and practical experience with large-scale data platforms (e.g., BigQuery).
Solid Python skills (for analytics and automation use cases).
Experience in applied statistics and designing and guiding complex A/B testing strategies
Proven track record in building scalable, user-centric dashboards and reporting tools (Tableau or similar).
Excellent communication and stakeholder management abilities; capable of translating business goals into analytics roadmaps.
Deep understanding of product development and business strategy, with experience aligning analytics to strategic outcomes.
Demonstrated mentorship and leadership capabilities within data/analytics functions.
Self-directed, highly versatile, and solution-oriented mindset.


Nice to have:


Experience with Airflow or similar orchestration tools.
Familiarity with Git and version control for analytics workflows.
Experience contributing to analytics infrastructure and self-service tooling.
Thought leadership in the field of analytics (e.g., talks, papers, forums).


Additional Information

Ensuring you and all our Heroes are looked after, happy, and healthy is always on the menu. Because if you‚Äôre in good shape, then we‚Äôre in good shape.


Make the most of our hybrid working model and join the team for face-to-face connection and collaboration in our beautiful Berlin campus 2 days a week
We offer 27 days holiday with an extra day on 2nd and 3rd year of service
We will support you in developing yourself and your career growth opportunities: 1.000 ‚Ç¨ Educational Budget, Language Courses, Parental Support and access to the Udemy Business platform to explore a variety of online courses.
Get moving and release those wonderful, mind-boosting endorphins: Health Checkups, Meditation, Yoga, Gym & Bicycle Subsidy
Cash. Dough. Cheddar. Whatever you call it, we‚Äôll help you with it: Employee Share Purchase Plan, Sabbatical Bank, Public Transportation Ticket Discount, Life & Accident Insurance, Corporate Pension Plan
The power of getting together over some food is unrivaled. Here are a few ways to help you do that. All the yum: Digital Meal Vouchers, Food Vouchers, Corporate Discounts. Courses.


Ready to join our team? If you‚Äôre excited to grow, collaborate and be part of the world‚Äôs leading delivery platform, we‚Äôd love to hear from you. Apply today!

We believe diversity and inclusion are key to creating not only an exciting product, but also an amazing customer and employee experience. Fostering this starts with hiring - therefore we do not discriminate on the basis of racial identities, religious beliefs, color, national origin, gender identities or expressions, sexual orientations, age, marital or disability statuses, or any other aspect that makes you, you. We encourage you to let us know if you need any accommodations or specific accessibility support to ensure a smooth interview experience‚Äîjust include it in your application. You're welcome to share your pronouns (he/she/they) right from the start so we can address you respectfully from our first contact.

  • Cash. Dough. Cheddar. Whatever you call it, we‚Äôll help you with it: Employee Share Purchase Plan, Sabbatical Bank, Public Transportation Ticket Discount, Life & Accident Insurance, Corporate Pension Plan
  • The power of getting together over some food is unrivaled. Here are a few ways to help you do that. All the yum: Digital Meal Vouchers, Food Vouchers, Corporate Discounts. Courses.

Ready to join our team? If you‚Äôre excited to grow, collaborate and be part of the world‚Äôs leading delivery platform, we‚Äôd love to hear from you. Apply today!

We believe diversity and inclusion are key to creating not only an exciting product, but also an amazing customer and employee experience. Fostering this starts with hiring - therefore we do not discriminate on the basis of racial identities, religious beliefs, color, national origin, gender identities or expressions, sexual orientations, age, marital or disability statuses, or any other aspect that makes you, you. We encourage you to let us know if you need any accommodations or specific accessibility support to ensure a smooth interview experience‚Äîjust include it in your application. You're welcome to share your pronouns (he/she/they) right from the start so we can address you respectfully from our first contact.

Title: Senior Data Analyst
Description:
As a Senior Data Analyst at Blacklane, you will be at the forefront of our data-driven initiatives, transforming complex datasets into actionable insights that drive business decisions. Your role will involve developing dashboards, reports, and visualizations, collaborating with cross-functional teams to understand and meet their data needs, and conducting advanced statistical analyses. You will ensure data integrity and accuracy, communicate findings effectively, and contribute to the strategic direction of our data division within the engineering department. This position offers opportunities for continuous learning, flexible working arrangements, and participation in a diverse, inclusive environment.




YOUR CHALLENGE:

Analyze complex datasets to uncover trends, patterns, and actionable insights.
Develop and maintain dashboards, reports, and data visualizations to track key metrics.
Own part of our data transformation layer where we apply data modeling techniques (via dbt) to transform raw data into analytics-friendly data assets
Collaborate with cross-functional teams to understand business needs and translate them into data requirements.
Conduct advanced statistical analyses and predictive modeling to support strategic decision-making.
Ensure data integrity and accuracy through rigorous validation and quality checks.
Develop domain expertise in a set of business domains (e.g. Product, Marketing, Operations or Sales) to become a valuable partner to our business stakeholders
Communicate findings and recommendations effectively to stakeholders at all levels.

ABOUT YOU:

Bachelor‚Äôs degree in Data Science, Statistics, Computer Science, or a related field.
4+ years of experience in data analysis or a similar role.
Proficiency in SQL and data visualization tools (e.g., Tableau, Power BI, Looker).
Experience in data modeling using DBT
Strong analytical and problem-solving skills with the ability to interpret complex data sets.
Excellent communication and presentation skills.
Experience with statistical analysis and predictive modeling is a plus.







About Blacklane

Our mission is simple but powerful: to become the world‚Äôs leading premium, global chauffeur service. Operating in 50+ countries, we reimagine chauffeur-driven rides by prioritizing reliability, innovation, and first-class service at every step. Blacklane is also at the forefront of sustainable mobility efforts, continuously working to reduce our operational impact on the planet.




Our Company Culture

Blacklane has grown from a two-person startup in Berlin to a global team of over 300 people representing 54+ nationalities. Powered by our commitment to care, inclusion, innovation, and collaboration, we support employees through initiatives like Employee Resource Groups (ERGs), mentorship programs, and more.




Here are just a few examples of the ERGs fostering connection:

LGBTQIA+ Network ‚Äì Advocating for inclusivity and championing allyship.
Bookclub ‚Äì Encouraging cultural exchange, fostering discussion, critical thinking, and team engagement through shared reading and analysis.
Blacklane Cares Leave ‚Äì Spend up to eight paid hours annually volunteering for causes meaningful to you.

We welcome‚Äîand actively support‚Äîemployees to create or join the communities that are important to them.




Why join us in a Blacklane on the fast lane?

Fair Pay & Shared Success ‚Üí We provide good salaries and automatically enroll all employees in our Virtual Stock Options Plan (VSOP). Your shares vest over four years, with full transparency on their value growth through Ledgy.
Blacklane Mystery Rides ‚Üí As a valued contributor to our success and growth, we are pleased to offer you one complimentary ride per quarter to experience and evaluate our chauffeur services firsthand.
Learning & Development at Blacklane ‚Üí We value the person beyond the CV, which is why we are committed to your continuous growth‚Äînot just for the company‚Äôs success, but for your own professional development. We believe that when our employees stay ahead, so does Blacklane. That‚Äôs why you have free access to thousands of online courses on LinkedIn Learning, tailored to your career aspirations, along with a unique learning experience designed for those stepping into leadership roles.
The way to your heart goes through your stomach? ‚Üí If so, we‚Äôve got something special for you, in Berlin: our weekly homecooked, quality office lunches. Not only do they fuel your mind and body, but they also provide the perfect opportunity to connect with colleagues from all departments, fostering stronger bonds beyond your own division.
Your Health, No Compromise ‚Üí with Nilo Health & WHOOP
We prioritize both your mental and physical well-being because a healthy team creates a thriving culture. That‚Äôs why we offer access to the Nilo Health platform for mental wellness and the WHOOP bracelet, after one year to support your fitness‚Äîavailable for you to use as you choose.
Social responsibility ‚Üí We Care: Learn more about Miracle flights and the meaningful impact behind our commitment to making a difference.
Share your ideas with Blacklane‚Äôs C-Level ‚Üí Our approachable C-Level team values your insights. Once a month, they host a consultation day where you‚Äôre invited to share your ideas, feedback, and constructive criticism‚Äîbecause your voice shapes our future.
Thrive Together ‚Üí Our Hybrid Office Culture: At Blacklane, we believe in the power of in-person collaboration and connection. That‚Äôs why we follow a hybrid, 3 office day focused approach. This supports both our fast-paced growth and the building of strong, engaged teams. We know everyone‚Äôs situation is unique, so our hybrid setup still allows for flexibility when needed. If you‚Äôre excited about contributing in a dynamic, people-driven environment and value both teamwork and personal accountability, we‚Äôd love to hear from you!




Do you have any questions or want to know more about our way of working? Feel free to contact us. We‚Äôre happy to connect!

We place great value on equal opportunities. Therefore, we welcome everyone to apply!




Curious to see us in action? Let‚Äôs go!

‚Üí Watch us on Amazon Prime‚Üí Listen to our CEO in Startup insider episode #1643

‚Üí Blacklane is backed by investors who share our vision: Mercedes-Benz Mobility, Tasaru, Sixt, the Al Fahim Group, Alstin Capital, RI Digital Ventures, and b2venture

Title: Data Operations Analyst ‚Äì Adsquare Data (m/f/d)
Description:
Hi there, we are‚Ä¶ a highly motivated and skilled team, where everyone's role has a real impact on the company's growth. Success and fun are combined in a great company culture with people from all over the world, that creates a melting pot of individuals with more than 20 different Nationalities!


Be part of a ambitious company whose drive is to take the advertising world into a new era
Build digital products which aim at connecting both the digital and analog world for Advertisers


Aufgaben

Own Adsquare Data Execution & Automation


Ensure Adsquare Data is prepared and delivered seamlessly
Build workflows & automation to reduce manual operational work
Monitor & improve data quality ‚Äì ensuring data is accurate, reliable, and up-to-date
Proactively identify & resolve operational bottlenecks before they impact the business


Optimise Data Distribution & Integrations


Ensure seamless data syndication across DSPs, DMPs, and platforms
Work with Data Analytics Engineers to automate taxonomy mapping & partner integrations
Implement monitoring & alerting systems to detect issues before they impact revenue


Operational Efficiency & Scalability


Improve data ingestion & monitoring processes to ensure stable data pipelines
Analyse partner usage & adoption trends to optimise performance & distribution
Drive efficiency in package management & taxonomy distribution
Collaborate with the Product & Commercial teams to support pricing & data availability


Profil


Highly passionate about data
Passionate about data operations ‚Äì ensuring smooth ingestion, processing, and delivery
A problem solver & automation enthusiast ‚Äì always looking for ways to reduce manual effort
Experienced in managing data pipelines & ingestion workflows (4+ years in Data Ops, Data Engineering, or AdTech)
Familiar with AdTech & programmatic advertising (DSPs, audience segmentation, taxonomy)
Proficient in SQL, Python, ETL workflows/DBT, cloud data infrastructure (AWS, GCP, Snowflake, etc.)
Experienced with data monitoring & quality control ‚Äì ensuring accuracy & compliance
Able to work across teams ‚Äì collaborating with Engineering, Product, and Partnerships
A self-starter who can take ownership and drive improvements in scalability & efficiency


You feel that you don't meet all but most requirements?

Wir bieten

Apply anyway. You have the chance to develop further with us.


Become part of an amazing team which is crazy enough to believe they can change how advertising is done
Unfold your abilities and to let your ideas become reality - Because everyone of us has a say in what we do


Why us?

Important note

Please be advised that a valid work permit for Germany is required for non-EU citizens. Unfortunately, applications without a valid work permit and sufficient German language skills may not be considered.

Title: Intern, Data Labeler (Arabic Speaker) - (Global Discovery, Consumer)
Description:
As the world‚Äôs pioneering local delivery platform, our mission is to deliver an amazing experience, fast, easy, and to your door. We operate in over 70+ countries worldwide, powered by tech, designed by people. As one of Europe‚Äôs largest tech platforms, headquartered in Berlin, Germany. Delivery Hero has been listed on the Frankfurt Stock Exchange since 2017 and is part of the MDAX stock market index. We enable creative minds to deliver solutions that create impact within our ecosystem. We move fast, take action and adapt. No matter where you're from or what you believe in, we build, we deliver, we lead. We are Delivery Hero.

Job Description

We are on the lookout for an Intern, Data Labeler (Arabic Speaker) to join the Discovery team on our journey to always deliver amazing experiences.

At Delivery Hero, you‚Äôll shape the global consumer experience for millions of users. Your work will have a direct impact on how we attract and retain customers, creating data-driven, personalized interactions that keep them coming back. As part of our Consumer Team, you‚Äôll enhance customer satisfaction and drive global growth and profitability through innovative projects.

At the center of our marketplace is the Discovery organization. This team is currently building Search, Recommendation, and intent collection systems to power our brands like Foodpanda, Glovo, Pedidos Ya, Talabat - serving millions of requests every day. The systems we build are critical for our online marketplaces with high availability and performance requirements and drive meaningful commercial value. They require crafting control loops through data, machine learning, and online serving systems to serve millions of consumers worldwide.

In this role you will


Accurately label and annotate various types of data, including images, text, audio, and video.
Helping us in maintaining data quality and consistency, which directly impacts users' search experience, by adhering to established guidelines.
Collaborate with the team to identify and resolve labeling discrepancies.
Provide feedback on labeling guidelines and suggest improvements.


Qualifications


Currently doing a Bachelor‚Äôs or Master‚Äôs degree in a related field: Business/Finance/Accounting/Engineering or recently graduated.
Ability to deal with lots of data resources and documents
Fluency in spoken and written English & Arabic.
Availability of 20 hours per week for 6 months.


Nice to have:


interest in machine learning concepts.
Experience with specific data labeling tools.


Additional Information

Ensuring you and all our Heroes are looked after, happy, and healthy is always on the menu. Because if you‚Äôre in good shape, then we‚Äôre in good shape.


Make the most of our hybrid working model and join the team for face-to-face connection and collaboration in our beautiful Berlin campus 2 days a week
We offer 27 days holiday with an extra day on 2nd and 3rd year of service
We will support you in developing yourself and your career growth opportunities: 1.000 ‚Ç¨ Educational Budget, Language Courses, Parental Support and access to the Udemy Business platform to explore a variety of online courses.
Get moving and release those wonderful, mind-boosting endorphins: Health Checkups, Meditation, Gym & Bicycle Subsidy
Cash. Dough. Cheddar. Whatever you call it, we‚Äôll help you with it: Employee Share Purchase Plan, Sabbatical Bank, Public Transportation Ticket Discount, Life & Accident Insurance, Corporate Pension Plan
The power of getting together over some food is unrivaled. Here are a few ways to help you do that. All the yum: Digital Meal Vouchers, Food Vouchers, Corporate Discounts. Courses.


Ready to join our team? If you‚Äôre excited to grow, collaborate and be part of the world‚Äôs leading delivery platform, we‚Äôd love to hear from you. Apply today!

We believe diversity and inclusion are key to creating not only an exciting product, but also an amazing customer and employee experience. Fostering this starts with hiring - therefore we do not discriminate on the basis of racial identities, religious beliefs, color, national origin, gender identities or expressions, sexual orientations, age, marital or disability statuses, or any other aspect that makes you, you. We encourage you to let us know if you need any accommodations or specific accessibility support to ensure a smooth interview experience‚Äîjust include it in your application. Title: Clinical Data Specialist (m/f/d)
Description:
We‚Äôre looking for a Clinical Data Specialist to help us accomplish our mission to improve and extend lives by learning from the experience of every person with cancer. Are you ready to be the next changemaker in cancer care?

Flatiron Health is a healthtech company using data for good to power smarter care for every person with cancer, around the world. Flatiron partners with cancer centres in the US, Europe and Asia to transform patients‚Äô real-life experiences into real-world evidence and create a more modern, connected oncology ecosystem. Our multidisciplinary teams include oncologists, data scientists, software engineers, epidemiologists, product experts and more. Flatiron Health is an independent affiliate of the Roche Group.

What You'll Do

In this role, you will be responsible for working with the clinical and product teams to execute on and further develop our end-to-end abstraction processes. Abstraction involves extracting complex unstructured clinical data from electronic medical records using our proprietary abstraction software, ensuring high quality data that benefit cancer patients and researchers. In this role you will:



Develop and update data curation instruction documents as well as data capture forms for multiple solid tumour types and hematologic malignancies, respectively, and their diagnostic and therapeutic areas
Support data quality and control activities, including maintenance and improvement of existing QA processes, clarifying guidance, correcting errors and refining abstraction instructions in order to build up and maintain high quality data sets
Plan feasibility and initial testing of novel data points or new abstraction approaches
Contribute to product development by synthesizing data and feedback to provide insights about the abstraction process (e.g., to support development of our abstraction tool and leverage machine learning and automatisation)
Support quality assurance on dataset deliverables and data analyses
Collaborate with a cross-functional team including technical (e.g., software engineering, data science), product managers, product designers, data privacy experts, quantitative scientists, and clinical professionals. By presenting your work processes and results, you keep your direct and extended team up to date with your work progress
Weigh tradeoffs (e.g., upside/downside for different options) and clearly communicate data-driven recommendations to influence cross-functional stakeholders
Provide clinical experience to support the processing and harmonisation of structured data points



Who You Are

You're a kind, passionate and collaborative problem-solver who values the opportunity to think beyond the way things are. In addition, you‚Äôre a team player with experience in clinical and/or data documentation experience in the oncology/haematology space across multiple tumour types. Furthermore:



You are certified as a study nurse, physician, or other form clinical professional, or you have a comparable professional education, or you have a bachelor's or master's degree in the fields of health sciences, biology, molecular medicine, or a related applied science, or you have education as a nurse with additional training or several years of clinical work in oncology/haematology
You are familiar with all aspects of how cancer is managed, from diagnosis until cessation of treatment, and fluent in cancer terminology as well as in general German medical terminology
You have experience with the presentation of clinical data (e.g. ICD codes, cancer registry data) and the treatment pathways in oncology care
You have familiarity with electronic health record systems, electronic data capture forms, or other data management systems
You have strong communication skills, including the ability to communicate clinical issues effectively with a diverse team of software engineers, product managers, and other technical staff
You demonstrate exceptional attention to detail but you are also pragmatic in the search for solutions
You enjoy working in a fast-paced, cross functional and international environment and are able to react with flexibility to ambiguity
You are fluent in German (C-level) and have very good English proficiencies (minimum requirement B2-level)



Optional



You have experience in enabling ML tooling



Who We Are

Our people are at the center of everything we do. We strive to foster a culture where our teammates feel equipped and empowered to make meaningful contributions with confidence, compassion, and clarity.
Show more

In this role you will:


  • Develop and update data curation instruction documents as well as data capture forms for multiple solid tumour types and hematologic malignancies, respectively, and their diagnostic and therapeutic areas
  • Support data quality and control activities, including maintenance and improvement of existing QA processes, clarifying guidance, correcting errors and refining abstraction instructions in order to build up and maintain high quality data sets
  • Plan feasibility and initial testing of novel data points or new abstraction approaches
  • Contribute to product development by synthesizing data and feedback to provide insights about the abstraction process (e.g., to support development of our abstraction tool and leverage machine learning and automatisation)
  • Support quality assurance on dataset deliverables and data analyses
  • Collaborate with a cross-functional team including technical (e.g., software engineering, data science), product managers, product designers, data privacy experts, quantitative scientists, and clinical professionals. By presenting your work processes and results, you keep your direct and extended team up to date with your work progress
  • Weigh tradeoffs (e.g., upside/downside for different options) and clearly communicate data-driven recommendations to influence cross-functional stakeholders
  • Provide clinical experience to support the processing and harmonisation of structured data points


Who You Are

You're a kind, passionate and collaborative problem-solver who values the opportunity to think beyond the way things are. In addition, you‚Äôre a team player with experience in clinical and/or data documentation experience in the oncology/haematology space across multiple tumour types. Furthermore:


  • You are certified as a study nurse, physician, or other form clinical professional, or you have a comparable professional education, or you have a bachelor's or master's degree in the fields of health sciences, biology, molecular medicine, or a related applied science, or you have education as a nurse with additional training or several years of clinical work in oncology/haematology
  • You are familiar with all aspects of how cancer is managed, from diagnosis until cessation of treatment, and fluent in cancer terminology as well as in general German medical terminology
  • You have experience with the presentation of clinical data (e.g. ICD codes, cancer registry data) and the treatment pathways in oncology care
  • You have familiarity with electronic health record systems, electronic data capture forms, or other data management systems
  • You have strong communication skills, including the ability to communicate clinical issues effectively with a diverse team of software engineers, product managers, and other technical staff
  • You demonstrate exceptional attention to detail but you are also pragmatic in the search for solutions
  • You enjoy working in a fast-paced, cross functional and international environment and are able to react with flexibility to ambiguity
  • You are fluent in German (C-level) and have very good English proficiencies (minimum requirement B2-level)


Optional


  • You have experience in enabling ML tooling


Who We Are

Our people are at the center of everything we do. We strive to foster a culture where our teammates feel equipped and empowered to make meaningful contributions with confidence, compassion, and clarity.

Title: Product Analyst
Description:
Data Analyst (Product) | AI-Powered Learning | Berlin (Onsite)

Join One of Europe‚Äôs Fastest-Growing EdTech Scaleups




We're on a mission to build the #1 AI learning companion for 1 billion students globally.

Founded by students in 2020, this fast-growing EdTech startup is redefining how young people learn‚Äîusing AI to create truly personalized, engaging learning experiences. Already trusted by millions of students weekly, the company recently raised ‚Ç¨27M in Europe‚Äôs largest EdTech funding round in the past three years.




With a world-class team and a bold vision, they're building something generational‚Äîand this is your chance to be part of it.




Your Mission: Use Data to Shape the Future of Learning

What You'll Own

Build tools and dashboards that enable every team to move faster and smarter

Ensure marketing and growth teams have clean, actionable data

Clear communicator with strong critical thinking skills

Why Join?

Shape a category-defining AI product that impacts students around the world
Join a mission-driven team of 60+ high-calibre builders
Be part of one of Europe‚Äôs most exciting AI startups
Work in an environment where data is at the heart of everything

Title: Data Analyst / Datenmanager (m/w/d) im Bereich Erstattungsprozesse
Description:
Wer wir sind ‚Äì Sicherheit f√ºr Reisende, Stabilit√§t f√ºr die Reisebranche

Der Deutsche Reisesicherungsfonds (DRSF) wurde 2021 gegr√ºndet, um Pauschalreisende vor den finanziellen Folgen einer Insolvenz ihres Reiseveranstalters zu sch√ºtzen und gleichzeitig die Stabilit√§t und das Vertrauen in die Reisebranche zu sichern, indem wir Marktteilnehmer entlasten, gesetzliche Vorgaben erf√ºllen und ein effizientes Krisenmanagement im Insolvenzfall gew√§hrleisten.

Beim Deutschen Reisesicherungsfonds gestaltest du als Data Analyst / Datenmanager (m/w/d) die Datenbasis hinter der Absicherung von Pauschalreisen.

Du verantwortest die Datenqualit√§t, steuerst ETL-Prozesse, entwickelst aussagekr√§ftige Reports und unterst√ºtzt datenbasierte Entscheidungen ‚Äì an der Schnittstelle von Datenmanagement, Reporting und Prozessoptimierung in einem Umfeld mit hoher gesellschaftlicher Relevanz.

Deine Mission


Du pflegst, strukturierst und analysierst Stamm-, Zahlungs- und Buchungsdaten in enger Abstimmung mit IT und Fachbereichen.
Du entwickelst, optimierst und dokumentierst ETL-Prozesse zur strukturierten Datenintegration aus unterschiedlichen Quellsystemen.
Du √ºberwachst Datenfl√ºsse und Schnittstellen (z.‚ÄØB. ERP-, Buchungs- oder CRM-Systeme) und definierst Anforderungen an Datenprozesse.
Du erstellst Dashboards, KPIs und automatisierte Reports mit Power BI, Excel, SQL oder Python ‚Äì verst√§ndlich und adressatengerecht.
Du sicherst Datenqualit√§t, Konsistenz und Nachvollziehbarkeit und entwickelst Standards weiter ‚Äì auch mit Blick auf Data Governance.
Du begleitest datengetriebene Prozessverbesserungen und gestaltest die Grundlage f√ºr strategische Entscheidungen


Profil


Du hast ein abgeschlossenes Studium in Datenmanagement, Wirtschaftsinformatik, Statistik oder eine vergleichbare Qualifikation.
Du verf√ºgst √ºber mehrj√§hrige Berufserfahrung als Data Analyst, Datenmanager oder Reporting Specialist ‚Äì idealerweise im Finanz- oder Prozessumfeld.
Du arbeitest sicher mit Power BI, Excel und hast fundierte Kenntnisse in SQL oder Python.
Du hast Erfahrung mit ETL-Strecken, Datenintegration und Datenmodellierung ‚Äì auch in komplexen Systemlandschaften.
Du denkst analytisch, dokumentierst strukturiert und verstehst es, Daten verst√§ndlich aufzubereiten und zu visualisieren.
Du bringst idealerweise Kenntnisse in agilen Methoden (Scrum, Kanban) oder Prozessmodellierung mit.
Du verf√ºgst √ºber sehr gute Deutschkenntnisse in Wort und Schrift sowie gute Englischkenntnisse


Pers√∂nlich √úberzeugst Du Mit


Deiner sorgf√§ltigen, eigenverantwortlichen und strukturierten Arbeitsweise.
Deiner F√§higkeit, komplexe Sachverhalte verst√§ndlich zu analysieren, zu kommunizieren und L√∂sungen abzuleiten.
Deinem analytischen Blick, deinem Organisationsgeschick und deinem Wunsch, Daten wirklich nutzbar zu machen.
Deiner Offenheit f√ºr interdisziplin√§re Zusammenarbeit ‚Äì mit IT, Fachbereichen und externen Partnern.
Deiner Verl√§sslichkeit und deinem Qualit√§tsanspruch ‚Äì in Daten wie im Ergebnis.


Wir bieten


Bei uns findest du mehr als nur einen Job ‚Äì du √ºbernimmst Verantwortung in einem engagierten Team.
Ein stabiler Arbeitsplatz mit langfristigen Perspektiven
Neben einem wettbewerbsf√§higen Gehalt bieten wir auch umfangreiche Sozialleistungen.
Ob Homeoffice, flexible Arbeitszeiten oder individuelle L√∂sungen - wir wissen, dass Beruf und Privatleben vereinbar sein muss.
Deine Ideen z√§hlen ‚Äì wir f√∂rdern Eigeninitiative, Weiterentwicklung und ein respektvolles Miteinander auf Augenh√∂he.


Klingt nach dir?

Dann bewirb dich hier!

Important note

Please be advised that a valid work permit for Germany is required for non-EU citizens. Unfortunately, applications without a valid work permit and sufficient German language skills may not be considered.

Description:

CRM) und Sales mit Analysen, Dashboards und Empfehlungen ‚Äì zu Themen wie Inventar, Monetarisierung sowie H√§ndlerakquise und -bindung. 2+ Jahre Erfahrung in einer datengetriebenen Rolle, idealerweise im B2B- oder E-Commerce-Umfeld.
Sehr gute Kenntnisse in SQL und Gesp√ºr f√ºr performante, wartbare Abfragen.
Erfahrung mit Tableau oder vergleichbaren BI-Tools sowie ein gutes Auge f√ºr klare, zielgruppengerechte Visualisierungen.
Du kommunizierst analytische Erkenntnisse klar und zielgruppenorientiert auf Englisch (Deutschkenntnisse sind ein Plus) ‚Äì auch f√ºr nicht-technische Stakeholder.
Idealerweise erste Kenntnisse in Python, R oder in der AWS-Infrastruktur (z.‚ÄØB. Glue, Athena).

Bei idealo erwartet dich


Du brauchst Urlaub? Wir bieten dir 30 Tage Urlaub. Reicht nicht? Du kannst jedes Jahr 15 weitere Tage zus√§tzlich per Gehaltsumwandlung ‚Äúkaufen‚Äù.
Du willst dich weiterbilden? Wir nehmen deine pers√∂nlichen Entwicklungsziele ernst und bieten dir neben unserem idealo Learning Hub, eLearning Angeboten (z.B. Udemy), Coachings & Mediation auch die M√∂glichkeit individuell von unserem Weiterbildungsbudget zu profitieren.
Und was kann das B√ºro? Unser B√ºro, im Herzen Berlins, bietet neben dem ‚ÄúStandard-Kicker‚Äù auch hervorragendes kostenfreies Mittagessen, sowie kostenfreien Kaffee, Limonade und Feierabend-Bier. Dabei kannst du auf unserer wundersch√∂nen Dachterrasse mit Kolleg:innen aus unserer Unternehmensgruppe netzwerken.
Du willst auch mobil sein? Mit Job-Bike oder Deutschlandticket kein Problem ‚Äì und das ist auch noch umweltfreundlich!
Du wohnst noch nicht in Deutschland? Wir unterst√ºtzen dich im Visa-Prozess und bei deiner Relocation.
Du m√∂chtest dich fit halten? Hierzu bieten wir dir viele unterschiedliche Fitness- und Sportm√∂glichkeiten wie zum Beispiel eine Urban Sports oder Gympass Mitgliedschaft f√ºr deine ganz pers√∂nlichen Bed√ºrfnisse an.


√úber idealo

idealo ist eine Erfolgsgeschichte aus Berlin: Im Jahr 2000 sind wir mit der Mission gestartet, unseren Nutzer:innen zu helfen, richtige Kaufentscheidungen zu treffen. Bei uns arbeiten √ºber 700 Mitarbeiter:innen aus 60 Nationen an der Zukunft des Online-Shoppings. Wir konzentrieren uns auf agiles und eigenverantwortliches Arbeiten, Nachhaltigkeit und ein gesundes Verh√§ltnis von Arbeit und Privatleben. Diese Werte sind fest in unserer Unternehmenskultur verankert und tragender Bestandteil unserer Unternehmensphilosophie.

Als Teil unseres Teams kannst du dich auf Freiheit, ein internationales und inspirierendes Arbeitsumfeld freuen. Deine Ideen sind uns dabei besonders wichtig. Unser Produktportfolio ist so vielf√§ltig, wie die Menschen, die daran mitarbeiten. Chancengleichheit, Diversit√§t und Inklusion geh√∂ren zu unserer bunten Unternehmenskultur. Deswegen wollen wir dich so, wie du bist. Unabh√§ngig davon, wo du herkommst, welche Hautfarbe du hast, woran du glaubst, mit welchem Geschlecht du dich identifizierst, wen du liebst oder ob du eine Behinderung hast.

Hinweis f√ºr Bewerber:innen mit Behinderung:‚ÄØAls Bewerber:in mit Behinderung kannst du dich w√§hrend des Bewerbungsprozesses von unserer Schwerbehindertenvertretung (SBV) beraten lassen. Informiere uns hierzu gerne.

F√ºr die Inklusion von Menschen mit Behinderungen ist unser B√ºro stufenlos erreichbar. Gemeinsam schauen wir, was noch ben√∂tigt wird, wenn du bei uns startest!
