Title: Data Analyst - Excel, Power BI
Description:
Data Analyst - Excel, Power BI

Data Analyst - Excel, Power BI




The location of the role is Paddington, London (hybrid working).

The duration of the contract is 8 months.

The pay rate on offer is ¬£300 - ¬£350 per day (via Umbrella agency).




The client is a multinational high-street retailer.

Business area: Food Packaging




Key accountabilities and measures

Provide analytical support and reports based on data research and analysis to the Compliance Team to drive data consistency and accuracy
Resolve commercial and technical queries for all stakeholders and provide appropriate commentary to ensure clarity on root cause and avoid any reoccurrence
Deliver efficient analytical reports and insights through data research and analysis to support the Compliance Team in driving data submissions accuracy
Effective co-ordination of data gathering processes to ensure alignment with external and internal reporting requirements
Collate and maintain data reports within agreed standards
Liaise internally and externally with departments, suppliers, and compliance agencies
Ensure timely transfer of raw sales data and packaging information from different business areas
Assist compliance team with data verification for reporting and ensuring data declarations completed and submitted to schedule
Monitor and audit data quality and report any issues to key stakeholders
Identify problems and recommend solutions to improve the processes and ways or working.
Ongoing training to confidently work with the business‚Äô systems GMOR, SAP, PLM, FIND, Business objects, etc.
Resolve administrative problems and inquiries with reporting from the compliance agencies
Prepare written responses to routine enquiries
Raise any system issue logs with Tech support and ensure resolution the completion
Raise Purchase Orders and maintain the Compliance Invoicing tracker for the function.




Key skills and experience

Excellent knowledge and practical skills of Excel (PivotTables, VLOOKUP) and other Microsoft Office programs - Power BI
Ability to simultaneously manage, prioritise and deliver multiple projects/priorities on time
Strong delivery focus with great attention to detail, routine process, and completion of tasks.
Commitment to continuous improvement of digital and data skills
Confident and professional verbal and written communication skills
Takes initiative and comfortable working autonomously
Ability to initiate and build strong relationships with own team, across functions and channels

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
About Bionic:
Bionic is a tech-enabled business switching service. We empower small business owners with a radically better way for them to sort their business essentials through smart technology.‚ÄØ‚ÄØ¬†¬†

We're currently looking for a Data Analyst to join us in a fast-paced environment where innovative ideas and projects come to life.¬†¬†

About the Role:


Do you take satisfaction in seeing your recommendations implemented in the real world? Are you analytically creative and motivated by new challenges? Do you have a passion for working with data to drive insight and improve customer understanding?¬†

At Bionic, data is core to our business and strategy, and this role is part of a team that is critical to delivering on this goal.¬†¬†¬†

This role will build on the firm data and reporting architecture to bring insight, clarity and simplicity to what can be a complex business, ultimately making things simple for our customers.¬† As such you will leverage best in class analytics and data tools.¬†

You will have access to a wealth of data from a multitude of sources and will be translating analysis into commercially actionable insight and recommendations in a fast-paced environment.¬† The role will involve working on best practice statistical and analytical techniques to not only discover but also to test and measure impact of key strategic initiatives.¬†

You will be an important member of the Analytics team, with opportunities to interact cross functionally with Marketing, IT, Digital, Product, Commercial and Finance teams.¬†

Ultimately, this would be a great role for a Junior Analyst who is looking to take the next step to developing their skills in a fast growing Tech company.¬†



Day-to-Day:


Be a key member a small team of technical analysts, responsible for delivering business critical analysis and insight¬†
Be hands on in the coding of Bionic data to deliver analytical solutions to business problems and opportunities¬†
Be creative in supporting the development of analytical solutions to drive proven business value¬†
Able to work in a fast-paced environment, having the confidence to voice your thoughts and opinions¬†¬†
Implementing rigorous testing and measurement: working on testing and measurement across products and functions, implementing methodologies to serve highly iterative and fast paced roadmap.¬†
Communicate analysis to drive engagement: Share analytical results in a commercial and compelling manner, with ability to visualise insights in a clear and concise format¬†
Keep up to date with new and emerging technologies: best in class techniques and application to real business problems¬†
Learn and help share knowledge to grow capability of the team and Bionic: ensure that learnings are shared within the team and the business to drive a data driven culture.¬† Actively participate in trainings, documentation of learnings and data/analytics sharing sessions


Essential Skills and Experience:


Confident User of SQL and Python¬†
Experience analysing large and complex datasets - Cloud-based data platforms preferred¬†
Understanding of statistical and data science techniques (e.g. forecasting, regression, clustering etc) to deliver business projects¬†
Experience in Data Visualisation (Tableau (preferred), Power BI, Looker)¬†
Degree level or higher in a numerate subject (e.g. Maths, Statistics, Economics, Operational Research or Computer Science)¬†
1-2 years' experience in a data analyst or similar role, preferably in a fast-paced commercial or digital environment.¬†


Who We're Looking For:


A commercially driven analyst for a Data and Analytics team passionate about driving business growth¬†¬†
Ability to demonstrate an analytical ‚Äòcuriosity' through innovative, data driven insights about business questions¬†
Ability to explore business impact and position analysis to deliver commercial value¬†
A self-starter that is curious and keen to learn new approaches and techniques as well as demonstrate innovation in approach¬†¬†
A keen sharer of information with the ability to translate analysis into insight and support delivery of compelling commercial recommendations¬†
Curious, proactive, ambitious, storyteller, loves solving complex problems and excited to help others and share the success, team player¬†
Experience working in cross-functional teams (with product, commercial, marketing and IT) is preferrable¬†¬†
It would be highly desirable if you had experience within one of the following: Digital, B2B, Retail and Customer Data




Interview process¬†


Initial conversation with one of our Talent Acquisition Team¬†
1st stage Teams¬†interview with the hiring manager and a colleague from the Data Analytics team¬†
2nd stage in-person case study-based interview¬†


About the Bionic Group¬†


Bionic has over 600 colleagues working across three office locations and four businesses; Bionic - London (HQ), Bionic Outbound - Luton, Think Business Loans - Chelmsford, and Smart -our Field based agents.¬†

Working at Bionic means provides you many opportunities to advance your career, with incredible progression, recognition, and reward.¬†

Benefits¬†¬†

Enhance your health & wellbeing üå±¬†

Private healthcare cover¬†
Employee Assistance Programme, including a virtual GP service, priority physio & talking therapies¬†
Eyecare scheme¬†

Taking time away from work üèñÔ∏è¬†

25 days annual leave plus the 8 UK bank holidays, increasing with tenure¬†
1 paid family/religious day of leave per year - following successful probation period¬†
1 paid charity volunteering day per year¬†
Option to buy/sell up to an additional 3 days leave per year¬†

Family matters: for the special moments üè†¬†

Enhanced maternity, paternity or shared parental leave¬†
2 days off for your wedding upon joining, and up to 5 days after 2 years' service¬†
Flexible working options & a hybrid work approach¬†

Financial wellbeing üí∏¬†

Auto-enrolled salary sacrifice pension scheme¬†¬†
Life assurance¬†
Season ticket Loans, salary advances & loans to buy/rent a home - based on tenure¬†
Cycle to work scheme¬†

Recognition üåü¬†

Highflyers incentive, a VIP experience for our high performers across Bionic group to celebrate success¬†
Company summer & Christmas party celebrations, business and local zonely & annual awards and recognition¬†¬†
Long service awards¬†

Do you take satisfaction in seeing your recommendations implemented in the real world? Are you analytically creative and motivated by new challenges? Do you have a passion for working with data to drive insight and improve customer understanding? 

At Bionic, data is core to our business and strategy, and this role is part of a team that is critical to delivering on this goal.   

This role will build on the firm data and reporting architecture to bring insight, clarity and simplicity to what can be a complex business, ultimately making things simple for our customers.  As such you will leverage best in class analytics and data tools. 

You will have access to a wealth of data from a multitude of sources and will be translating analysis into commercially actionable insight and recommendations in a fast-paced environment.  The role will involve working on best practice statistical and analytical techniques to not only discover but also to test and measure impact of key strategic initiatives. 

You will be an important member of the Analytics team, with opportunities to interact cross functionally with Marketing, IT, Digital, Product, Commercial and Finance teams. 

Ultimately, this would be a great role for a Junior Analyst who is looking to take the next step to developing their skills in a fast growing Tech company. 

Day-to-Day:

  • Be a key member a small team of technical analysts, responsible for delivering business critical analysis and insight 
  • Be hands on in the coding of Bionic data to deliver analytical solutions to business problems and opportunities 
  • Be creative in supporting the development of analytical solutions to drive proven business value 
  • Able to work in a fast-paced environment, having the confidence to voice your thoughts and opinions  
  • Implementing rigorous testing and measurement: working on testing and measurement across products and functions, implementing methodologies to serve highly iterative and fast paced roadmap. 
  • Communicate analysis to drive engagement: Share analytical results in a commercial and compelling manner, with ability to visualise insights in a clear and concise format 
  • Keep up to date with new and emerging technologies: best in class techniques and application to real business problems 
  • Learn and help share knowledge to grow capability of the team and Bionic: ensure that learnings are shared within the team and the business to drive a data driven culture.  Actively participate in trainings, documentation of learnings and data/analytics sharing sessions

Essential Skills and Experience:

  • Confident User of SQL and Python 
  • Experience analysing large and complex datasets - Cloud-based data platforms preferred 
  • Understanding of statistical and data science techniques (e.g. forecasting, regression, clustering etc) to deliver business projects 
  • Experience in Data Visualisation (Tableau (preferred), Power BI, Looker) 
  • Degree level or higher in a numerate subject (e.g. Maths, Statistics, Economics, Operational Research or Computer Science) 
  • 1-2 years' experience in a data analyst or similar role, preferably in a fast-paced commercial or digital environment. 

Who We're Looking For:

  • A commercially driven analyst for a Data and Analytics team passionate about driving business growth  
  • Ability to demonstrate an analytical ‚Äòcuriosity' through innovative, data driven insights about business questions 
  • Ability to explore business impact and position analysis to deliver commercial value 
  • A self-starter that is curious and keen to learn new approaches and techniques as well as demonstrate innovation in approach  
  • A keen sharer of information with the ability to translate analysis into insight and support delivery of compelling commercial recommendations 
  • Curious, proactive, ambitious, storyteller, loves solving complex problems and excited to help others and share the success, team player 
  • Experience working in cross-functional teams (with product, commercial, marketing and IT) is preferrable  
  • It would be highly desirable if you had experience within one of the following: Digital, B2B, Retail and Customer Data


Interview process 

  • Initial conversation with one of our Talent Acquisition Team 
  • 1st stage Teams interview with the hiring manager and a colleague from the Data Analytics team 
  • 2nd stage in-person case study-based interview 

About the Bionic Group 

Bionic has over 600 colleagues working across three office locations and four businesses; Bionic - London (HQ), Bionic Outbound - Luton, Think Business Loans - Chelmsford, and Smart -our Field based agents. 

Working at Bionic means provides you many opportunities to advance your career, with incredible progression, recognition, and reward. 

Benefits  

Enhance your health & wellbeing üå± 

  • Private healthcare cover 
  • Employee Assistance Programme, including a virtual GP service, priority physio & talking therapies 
  • Eyecare scheme 

Taking time away from work üèñÔ∏è 

  • 25 days annual leave plus the 8 UK bank holidays, increasing with tenure 
  • 1 paid family/religious day of leave per year - following successful probation period 
  • 1 paid charity volunteering day per year 
  • Option to buy/sell up to an additional 3 days leave per year 

Family matters: for the special moments üè† 

  • Enhanced maternity, paternity or shared parental leave 
  • 2 days off for your wedding upon joining, and up to 5 days after 2 years' service 
  • Flexible working options & a hybrid work approach 

Financial wellbeing üí∏ 

  • Auto-enrolled salary sacrifice pension scheme  
  • Life assurance 
  • Season ticket Loans, salary advances & loans to buy/rent a home - based on tenure 
  • Cycle to work scheme 

Recognition üåü 

  • Highflyers incentive, a VIP experience for our high performers across Bionic group to celebrate success 
  • Company summer & Christmas party celebrations, business and local zonely & annual awards and recognition  
  • Long service awards

Title: Junior Data Analyst
Description:
Job Title: Junior Data Analyst (Power BI / SQL)

Location: London (Hybrid ‚Äì 2 days onsite)

Salary: ¬£45,000 + Benefits

Job Type: Full-Time, Permanent




Are you a data-driven thinker using Power BI and SQL?

Looking for a collaborative environment where you can make a real impact while continuing to grow your skills?




We‚Äôre hiring a Data Analyst to join a growing team within a dynamic and forward-thinking Insurance services company with a global footprint. Reporting directly to the Group Data Lead, you‚Äôll play a hands-on role in developing high-quality dashboards, reporting tools, and data solutions used by internal stakeholders and external clients.




What You‚Äôll Be Doing:

Build and maintain Power BI dashboards, including externally-facing reports for clients and underwriting teams
Write SQL queries to extract, transform and support backend reporting
Collaborate with internal teams to gather requirements and translate them into insightful visualisations
Develop KPI dashboards and static reports (Excel, PowerPoint) for strategic insights
Support client rollouts and help onboard data-driven solutions




Tech Stack & Tools:

Power BI (including Paginated Reports)
SQL
Excel & PowerPoint
Familiarity with Microsoft Fabric is a bonus




Ideal Candidate:

1 years of experience in a Data Analyst or Reporting Analyst role
Solid experience with Power BI and confident using SQL
Strong communication skills ‚Äì able to work with both technical and non-technical teams
A proactive, delivery-focused mindset ‚Äì someone who takes ownership of tasks
Keen to learn and develop in a non-hierarchical, supportive environment
Comfortable working with small to mid-sized datasets (this is not a big data role)




What‚Äôs on Offer:

Competitive salary (up to ¬£45K)
Hybrid working ‚Äì 2 days per week in a central London office
A supportive team with mentorship from senior data professionals
Exposure to global teams across Europe, the US, and Asia
An inclusive, values-led culture with strong ethical foundations




If you're excited about leveraging your Power BI and SQL skills in a meaningful way and want to be part of a forward-thinking, global environment ‚Äî apply today!

Title: Insights Analyst
Place: City Of London, England, United Kingdom
Description:
Role: Business Insights Analyst

Role Type: Temporary ‚Äì 6 Months ‚Äì Full Time

Location: London ‚Äì St. Pancras ‚Äì x3 Days On-Site per week / x2 days Working Remote







Your New Company




As a Business Insights Analyst you will be working within the UK Oncology Insights and Analytics team to provide relevant insights and analysis to enable an optimal diagnosis of our business performance.




In this regard, the Business Insights Analyst will be responsible for analysing different data sources (sales data, competitive insights, activity, etc.) to generate insights aimed at delivering competitive advantage. In addition, the incumbent will also contribute to critical business processes connected to data automation, brand planning and financial planning.







Your New Role




Generate insights on patients, customers and NHS as well as brands, markets and TA by analysing multiple data sources to inform and influence business decisions
Deliver performance analytics on priority brands by (1) identifying patterns within the data, (2) uncovering insights / brand opportunities and (3) articulate useful recommendations
Support strategic planning and financial planning processes
Support data and analytics automation processes
Working closely with the BUs, develop a thorough understanding of current key business issues and provide solutions to support BU decision making
Proactively identifies blind spots and opportunities in terms of unanswered business questions and insights
Drive compliant processes according to AZ SoPs and Code of conduct




Essential Skills




3 to 5 years of experience in analytical or insights generation roles
Analytical skills, strong excel + power point skills
Knowledge of NHS and the pharma industry ‚Äì Oncology advantageous
Ability to distil impactful insights out of different data
Proven track record of working with senior stakeholders in a complex environment
Self-starter who can face challenges with positive attitude




Desirable Skills




Oncology knowledge / experience
Experience with PowerBI
Pharma Sales & Marketing experience







WHY ASTRAZENECA?




It's an exciting time to join AstraZeneca, a global business that's rapidly growing - there's a lot happening and even more to come. And we are a valued part of this journey. Respected partners across the business, we provide the platform that's going to power us to achieve more.




So, what's next?




Are you ready to bring new insights and fresh thinking to the table? Brilliant! We have one seat available, and we hope it's yours. Please apply with a copy of your CV.

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
Data Analyst - Data Migration to Workday HCM / Freelance (Inside IR35)




You‚Äôll be working closely with our colleagues across the ERP Transformation Team alongside our Finance, IT, Data & Tech teams and other broader functions to support our global employee data collection, reporting and updating. We are undergoing a large transformation across our People function and the ERP Transformation team has a vast array of projects with touchpoints across multiple projects. We need a data analyst to help us deliver accurate and timely global employee data reports whenever and however needed.




We are building a holistic, sustainable and scalable People Operating Model enabled by Workday HCM and other technology solutions, alongside new ways of working in our service delivery model, including payroll harmonization.




What you'll do




Reporting into the People Transformation Data Lead, you will:




¬∑ Become the company's subject matter expert in all things related to global employee data with curiosity and a willingness to dive into the details to understand the data, it sources and definitions.

¬∑ Filter and ‚Äúclean‚Äù data by reviewing validation reports.

¬∑ Update data within various source systems, which will require an understanding of our data lineage.

¬∑ Identify opportunities to establish and/or improve operational processes to update and maintain our data, improving quality and implementing scalable solutions for our employee data lifecycle.

¬∑ Document end to end data entry, update, and reporting processes.

¬∑ Assist with communications notifying stakeholders of new/improved processes.

¬∑ Responsible for stakeholder issue resolution.

¬∑ Assist with future upgrades and system enhancements which may include new software.

¬∑ Interpret stakeholder data reporting requirements, analyse data and provide outgoing reports.

¬∑ Scope out and support projects related to our data that span functions.

¬∑ Implement metrics and timelines with any data project required.

¬∑ Manage multiple data-related projects at one time, identifying and raising risks, dependencies, and prioritization concerns.




What you'll need:




¬∑ Analytical, quantitative, and problem-solving skills

¬∑ HCM / People Data Experience; Workday HCM a plus

¬∑ Workday Enterprise Interface Builder experience

¬∑ Experience of Data visualization tools

¬∑ Willingness to learn new tools and systems

¬∑ Ability to effectively communicate across a global community which requires an openness to diversity of thought, backgrounds and cultures

¬∑ Technology experience or interest

¬∑ Excellent verbal, written and interpersonal skills

¬∑ Comfortable in dealing with all levels of company leadership

¬∑ Team player but also able to determine workload and be self-motivated

¬∑ General enthusiasm for growth and a willingness to be hands on




Start date: 4th August

Duration: 12 month contract

Location: London (some days on-site required)

Rate: ¬£550-575 per day ** INSIDE IR35 **

Title: Junior Data Analyst
Description:
Role: Junior Data Analyst

Location: London, UK (Hybrid)

Salary: ¬£35k‚Äì¬£40k (DOE)




Are you a detail-driven analyst with a passion for data and automation? Join a specialist investment firm that partners with some of the most exciting high-growth software companies across Europe and the US. In this dynamic role, you‚Äôll play a critical part in streamlining data-driven workflows and powering smarter investment decisions through innovative tech.




This is an exciting opportunity for an early-career analyst to join a growing Data & Research function that sits at the heart of the firm‚Äôs investment strategy. You'll be part of a high-impact team driving digital transformation and working with modern tools to improve processes, insights, and decision-making.




Your Responsibilities:

Build and enhance data pipelines: Help design and maintain proprietary automation systems that support investment strategy.
Improve internal platforms: Collaborate on projects to streamline workflows and eliminate manual processes using modern tooling.
Deliver high-quality insights: Monitor key data metrics and trends to support investment research and decision-making.
Ensure data integrity: Validate and enrich datasets to maintain accuracy, completeness, and consistency across internal platforms.
Evaluate tools and vendors: Assist in reviewing and optimising external data providers and technical solutions.
Contribute to innovation: Continuously explore opportunities to improve systems through experimentation, automation, and modern engineering practices.




Requirements:

Bachelor‚Äôs degree in a STEM or data-oriented field such as Data Science, Computer Science, Engineering, Mathematics, or Economics.
A meticulous attention to detail and passion for accurate, high-quality data.
Interest in data automation and how technology enables smarter decision-making.
Exposure to or willingness to learn tools like Python, SQL, Zapier, n8n, or similar.
Ability to manage multiple projects simultaneously while delivering at pace.
Strong communication skills to collaborate across teams and share insights clearly with non-technical stakeholders.
A curiosity-driven mindset and eagerness to learn new technologies and data tools.




It's A Bonus If You Have:

Experience with Google Cloud Platform, APIs, or GitHub.
Familiarity with structured data entry, validation processes, or workflow automation.
A genuine interest in private equity, venture capital, or financial technology.




The Benefits:

Join a mission-driven firm focused on supporting exceptional software companies.
Opportunity to work on impactful projects that shape investment outcomes.
Hybrid work model with a collaborative London-based team.
Mentorship and growth opportunities tailored to early-career talent.
Competitive salary and long-term progression within a growing data function.




If you're a motivated Junior Data Analyst eager to apply your skills in a fast-paced, tech-enabled environment, we‚Äôd love to hear from you. Apply now and be part of a team turning data into competitive advantage.

Title: Insight and Reporting Analyst
Description:
Why PlayStation?

PlayStation isn‚Äôt just the Best Place to Play ‚Äî it‚Äôs also the Best Place to Work. Today, we‚Äôre recognized as a global leader in entertainment producing The PlayStation family of products and services including PlayStation¬Æ5, PlayStation¬Æ4, PlayStation¬ÆVR, PlayStation¬ÆPlus, acclaimed PlayStation software titles from PlayStation Studios, and more.

PlayStation also strives to create an inclusive environment that empowers employees and embraces diversity. We welcome and encourage everyone who has a passion and curiosity for innovation, technology, and play to explore our open positions and join our growing global team.

The PlayStation brand falls under Sony Interactive Entertainment, a wholly-owned subsidiary of Sony Group Corporation.

Our Team

The Commercial Management team within Channel Sales is responsible for planning, reporting and analysis of all commercial activity globally. Operating across the hardware, peripherals, software, PC and voucher businesses.

Voucher has seen significant growth in recent years to become a key revenue contributor and continues to evolve with the industry to create new business opportunities. The team is responsible for driving revenue to PlayStation Store and Services from the indirect channel, which covers areas such as retail and B2B. This is achieved through combining custom trade marketing solutions, local territory expertise, sales and customer data analysis, competitor reviews and collaboration with multiple internal teams, publishers and integrator partners.

Role Overview:

Reporting to the Director, Global Insight as Insight & Reporting Analyst, you will play a critical role in generating, consolidating, and presenting Global insight and performance reporting, focused on voucher and software business. This role is accountable for voucher reporting, assessing performance across critical initiatives and experiments, generating and sharing insight across the end-to-end voucher funnel from dispatch to sale to redemption, down to a retailer and store level.

What we‚Äôre looking for:

Lead critical metric and performance reporting across the voucher business


Own the current KPI and Domo performance reporting processes, developing elegant, automated solutions, and contributing from the new VSTAR asset to further evolve our understanding and ability to extract insight. Close collaboration across D2C, Channel Sales, Services and regional Sales Development teams to bring together weekly and monthly commentary, explaining variances vs. target.


Reporting and generation of insight for central initiatives and projects, leading voucher experimentation test & learn


Carry out incrementality and ROI analysis across a variety of retail activations, placements and campaigns, shaping future voucher strategy at retail. Leveraging assets such as promo UPC and VSTAR to develop and standardise tools and analysis for experimentation analysis.


Represent voucher business within regular forums


Presenting insight and performance updates across Commercial and cross-functional forums. Offering opinion and findings from a variety of initiatives and campaigns.


Support across wider console and PC software vertical


Partner with wider teams on insight and analysis around PC and console software, contributing to monthly performance updates and weekly commentary, by consolidating PC, 1P software, software market and voucher. Working closely with Reporting Analysts in D2C and Channel Sales to drive consistency of metrics, definitions, branding and look-and-feel across the reporting suite.


What we‚Äôre looking for:


A highly technical and skilled analyst, demonstrating a proactive, explorer mentality in driving value from data
A creative problem solver with commercial competence, not afraid to challenge existing process and thinking backed up by data and insight
Relevant experience as an analyst, data analyst, or other related occupation
Excitement and interest in video games and the Gaming industry an advantage
Relationship builder, who can communicate at different levels of the organisation effectively
An ability to manage and balance multiple tasks and projects with a keen eye for detail
Flexible approach to working hours to support global sales and business operations
BSc/BA (or equivalent) experience in Business/ Economics, Science or Mathematics preferred
Experience with the following analytical and visualisation tools would be an advantage: MicroStrategy, Domo, Tableau, Power BI, Power Query
Database querying experience (SQL) preferred
Strong Excel skills required


Benefits:


Discretionary bonus opportunity
Hybrid Working (within Flexmodes)
Private Medical Insurance
Dental Scheme
25 days holiday per year
On Site Gym
Subsidised Caf√©
Free soft drinks
On site bar
Access to cycle garage and showers


Please refer to our Candidate Privacy Notice for more information about how we process your personal information, and your data protection rights

Sony is an Equal Opportunity Employer. All persons will receive consideration for employment without regard to gender (including gender identity, gender expression and gender reassignment), race (including colour, nationality, ethnic or national origin), religion or belief, marital or civil partnership status, disability, age, sexual orientation, pregnancy, maternity or parental status, trade union membership or membership in any other legally protected category.

We strive to create an inclusive environment, empower employees and embrace diversity. We encourage everyone to respond.

PlayStation is a Fair Chance employer and qualified applicants with arrest and conviction records will be considered for employment.

HTML:
Why PlayStation?

PlayStation isn‚Äôt just the Best Place to Play ‚Äî it‚Äôs also the Best Place to Work. Today, we‚Äôre recognized as a global leader in entertainment producing The PlayStation family of products and services including PlayStation¬Æ5, PlayStation¬Æ4, PlayStation¬ÆVR, PlayStation¬ÆPlus, acclaimed PlayStation software titles from PlayStation Studios, and more.

PlayStation also strives to create an inclusive environment that empowers employees and embraces diversity. We welcome and encourage everyone who has a passion and curiosity for innovation, technology, and play to explore our open positions and join our growing global team.

The PlayStation brand falls under Sony Interactive Entertainment, a wholly-owned subsidiary of Sony Group Corporation.

Our Team

The Commercial Management team within Channel Sales is responsible for planning, reporting and analysis of all commercial activity globally. Operating across the hardware, peripherals, software, PC and voucher businesses.

Voucher has seen significant growth in recent years to become a key revenue contributor and continues to evolve with the industry to create new business opportunities. The team is responsible for driving revenue to PlayStation Store and Services from the indirect channel, which covers areas such as retail and B2B. This is achieved through combining custom trade marketing solutions, local territory expertise, sales and customer data analysis, competitor reviews and collaboration with multiple internal teams, publishers and integrator partners.

Role Overview:

Reporting to the Director, Global Insight as Insight & Reporting Analyst, you will play a critical role in generating, consolidating, and presenting Global insight and performance reporting, focused on voucher and software business. This role is accountable for voucher reporting, assessing performance across critical initiatives and experiments, generating and sharing insight across the end-to-end voucher funnel from dispatch to sale to redemption, down to a retailer and store level.

What we‚Äôre looking for:

Lead critical metric and performance reporting across the voucher business

  • Own the current KPI and Domo performance reporting processes, developing elegant, automated solutions, and contributing from the new VSTAR asset to further evolve our understanding and ability to extract insight. Close collaboration across D2C, Channel Sales, Services and regional Sales Development teams to bring together weekly and monthly commentary, explaining variances vs. target.

Reporting and generation of insight for central initiatives and projects, leading voucher experimentation test & learn

  • Carry out incrementality and ROI analysis across a variety of retail activations, placements and campaigns, shaping future voucher strategy at retail. Leveraging assets such as promo UPC and VSTAR to develop and standardise tools and analysis for experimentation analysis.

Represent voucher business within regular forums

  • Presenting insight and performance updates across Commercial and cross-functional forums. Offering opinion and findings from a variety of initiatives and campaigns.

Support across wider console and PC software vertical

  • Partner with wider teams on insight and analysis around PC and console software, contributing to monthly performance updates and weekly commentary, by consolidating PC, 1P software, software market and voucher. Working closely with Reporting Analysts in D2C and Channel Sales to drive consistency of metrics, definitions, branding and look-and-feel across the reporting suite.

What we‚Äôre looking for:

  • A highly technical and skilled analyst, demonstrating a proactive, explorer mentality in driving value from data
  • A creative problem solver with commercial competence, not afraid to challenge existing process and thinking backed up by data and insight
  • Relevant experience as an analyst, data analyst, or other related occupation
  • Excitement and interest in video games and the Gaming industry an advantage
  • Relationship builder, who can communicate at different levels of the organisation effectively
  • An ability to manage and balance multiple tasks and projects with a keen eye for detail
  • Flexible approach to working hours to support global sales and business operations
  • BSc/BA (or equivalent) experience in Business/ Economics, Science or Mathematics preferred
  • Experience with the following analytical and visualisation tools would be an advantage: MicroStrategy, Domo, Tableau, Power BI, Power Query
  • Database querying experience (SQL) preferred
  • Strong Excel skills required

Benefits:

  • Discretionary bonus opportunity
  • Hybrid Working (within Flexmodes)
  • Private Medical Insurance
  • Dental Scheme
  • 25 days holiday per year
  • On Site Gym
  • Subsidised Caf√©
  • Free soft drinks
  • On site bar
  • Access to cycle garage and showers

Title: Data Analyst, EMEA Supply Chain Operations ‚Äì 1 Year Fixed Contract
Description:
Job Description

Join our dynamic team at LEGO and play a pivotal role in transforming our EMEA Supply Chain Operations through innovative data solutions and process automation that drive efficiency and visibility!


Core Responsibilities





Develop impactful reporting through effective data sourcing, transformation, and visualization to provide operational insights that drive actionable outcomes.
Implement digital process automation in line with Citizen Development guidelines, to enhance operational efficiency in Supply Chain Operations.
Ensure data quality and compliance across all reporting and optimization initiatives by applying data governance principles.
Follow established standards for robust, documented, and supportable solutions with effective change management.
Collaborate with operational teams to gather user stories, assess business goals, risks, and anticipated value.
Share processes and technical solutions to support the definition of global standards, enhancing value as One LEGO Team.
Promote digital capabilities by educating and empowering teams with digital skills.
Build understanding of Global Supply Chain processes and leverage data solutions to improve operational performance.




Play your part in our team succeeding

By joining EMEA Supply Chain Operations, you will have the opportunity to work with our talented team and play an active part in putting our products into the hands of children across EMEA.

The EMEA Supply Chain Operations Technology function is part of the EMEA Supply Chain Operations organization, and supports and optimizes our operations, providing accurate, engaging and timely information to operational teams to support delivery of our priorities.

Acting as functional experts, the team supports a range of digital solutions, from collaborative creation of user stories to development, delivery and support of data solutions.

To support our digitalization journey, the function also plays an active role in building digital awareness and capability across the EMEA Supply Chain Operations organization.

Do you have what it takes?





Advanced expertise in Microsoft Power BI (incl. DAX), with strong capabilities in complex data transformation beyond visualization.
Advanced expertise in SQL or Python.
Experience across a range of data tools and platforms (such as Databricks, Alteryx, Microsoft Power Platform, for flexible data sourcing, transformation, visualization, and automation).
Proven analytical skills with Agile problem-solving experience, exceptional attention to detail, and a proactive, driven approach.
A strong communicator,that is able to translate technical concepts for non-technical audiences.
Committed to building inclusive, collaborative team environments.
Preferred Supply Chain exposure, Databricks, Alteryx and SAP experience.




Please note that we do not offer relocation assistance for this position.

Applications are reviewed on an ongoing basis. However, please note we do amend or withdraw our jobs and reserve the right to do so at any time, including prior to any advertised closing date. So, if you're interested in this role we encourage you to apply as soon as possible.

What‚Äôs in it for you?

Here is what you can expect

Family Care Leave - We offer enhanced paid leave options for those important times.

Insurances ‚Äì All colleagues are covered by our life and disability insurance which provides protection and peace of mind.

Wellbeing - We want our people to feel well and thrive. We offer resources and benefits to nurture physical and mental wellbeing along with opportunities to build community and inspire creativity.

Colleague Discount ‚Äì We know you'll love to build, so from day 1 you will qualify for our generous colleague discount.

Bonus - We do our best work to succeed together. When goals are reached and if eligible, you'll be rewarded through our bonus scheme.

Workplace - When you join the team you'll be assigned a primary workplace location i.e. one of our Offices, stores or factories. Our hybrid work policy means an average of 3 days per week in the office. The hiring team will discuss the policy and role eligibility with you during the recruitment process.

Children are our role models. Their curiosity, creativity and imagination inspire everything we do. We strive to create a diverse, dynamic and inclusive culture of play at the LEGO Group, where everyone feels safe, valued and they belong.

The LEGO Group is highly committed to equal employment opportunity and equal pay and seeks to encourage applicants from all backgrounds (eg. sex, gender identity or expression, race/ethnicity, national origin, sexual orientation, disability, age and religion) to apply for roles in our team.

The LEGO Group is fully committed to Children‚Äôs Rights and Child Wellbeing across the globe. Candidates offered positions with high engagement with children are required to take part in Child Safeguarding Background Screening, as a condition of the offer.

Thank you for sharing our global commitment to Children‚Äôs Rights.

Just imagine building your dream career.

Then make it real.

Join the LEGO¬Æ team today.

Title: Data Analyst
Company: Halian | Managed Services, Recruitment Agency & Contract Staffing
Description:
We are seeking a skilled Data Analyst with a good understanding in data modeling / data warehouse development, and business intelligence tooling to join my clients payments team, within the fintech space. This role is pivotal in building and optimizing data systems and pipelines that support analytics, reporting.




Key Responsibilities

Develop high-quality Power BI and Tableau dashboards, supporting business teams in making data-informed decisions.
Ensure data integrity, reliability, and performance through testing, monitoring, and documentation.
Exposure to Data Modelling and Warehousing would beneficial as you will need to build data models or migrate existing ones.
Drive best practices in data governance, metadata management, and data security.
Contribute to the continuous improvement of our data platform and tooling.




Required Skills & Experience

3‚Äì5 + years of experience as a Data Analyst, preferably in a FinTech or Payments environment.
Exposure and a good understansinf in data modeling (dimensional and normalized), ETL/ELT design, and data warehousing techniques.
Proficiency in SQL and experience with scripting languages such as Python or Scala.
Demonstrated ability to create impactful dashboards using Power BI and Tableau.
Deep understanding of data pipeline orchestration tools (e.g., Airflow, dbt, Azure Data Factory).
Experience working in agile, cross-functional teams, collaborating closely with data analysts, engineers, and business stakeholders.
Strong problem-solving skills, attention to detail, and an ability to balance short-term fixes with long-term scalable solutions.




Nice to Have

Experience with real-time or streaming data (Kafka, Kinesis).
Familiarity with financial transaction data or payment processing systems.
Exposure to data privacy regulations (e.g., GDPR, PCI-DSS) and data security best practices




This role offers a 2 stage interview process and is required to work on site 3 days a week in central London.




Apply now to be considered!

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
Data Analyst, 6 months, London/Hybrid, ¬£500+/day (Outside IR35)




My client, a leader in the hospitality industry, are currently looking to bring on a Data Engineer or Data Analyst on a 6 month initial contract.




Position Overview

We are seeking a Data Engineer / Data Analyst / Analytics consultant to join the Service Desk team on a contract basis. This role will be instrumental in analysing the current IT service request landscape, developing a structured service catalogue, and implementing improvements through runbooks and automation. The ideal candidate will have strong analytical skills and experience with data classification, Zendesk or ServiceNow.




Key Responsibilities




Service Request Analysis & Categorisation

Discover patterns in data by analysing existing service/support requests across multiple channels and systems
Turn raw data into relevant insights by developing and implementing a comprehensive categorisation system
Extract and analyse data from Zendesk/ServiceNow and other systems to identify patterns, frequencies, and resolution times
Create compelling data visualisations and reporting using tools like Excel or Looker to highlight key metrics and trends




Service Catalogue Development

Design and implement a comprehensive IT service catalogue for the organisation
Assess and assign business criticality and priority levels to different service types
Create and maintain good documentation around our data and processes to document requirements, data models, data classifications, and solutions




Please apply for more information

Title: Data Analyst, Reporting & Operations
Description:
OVERVIEW

Company description

Publicis Groupe is one of the world‚Äôs largest communications holding companies, present in over 110 countries and employing about 100,000 professionals.. The Groupe is positioned at every step of the value chain, from consulting to execution, combining marketing transformation and digital business transformation.

HELPING OUR CLIENTS UNLOCK GROWTH IN THE PLATFORM WORLD

Our clients compete in the platform world, a horizontal marketplace between creators and consumers, between speakers and listeners, between buyers and sellers. To thrive in the platform world, companies must continue to innovate their products and business models. Four imperatives (1. Real Identity, 2. Dynamic, Diverse and Disruptive Creativity 3., Smart Media and 4. Direct Relationships) via our suite of world-class agencies, are necessary for modern brands to win in the platform world. At Publicis Groupe, we‚Äôve invested in capabilities across these four imperatives our clients need to unlock growth. As the only one who can architect, build and orchestrate end to end solutions, not only do we have a proven record of building bespoke models for clients and leading expertise across all major industry categories, we are able to offer our talents more opportunities to grow and benefit from a richer learning experience. We call this Power of One. Powered by a 100,000-strong network via Marcel, our AI-based platform, we are also able to provide our clients and talents instant access to resource, knowledge for any need, any time, in any market.

THE SPIRIT OF VIVA LA DIFFERENCE

Viva La Difference is deeply rooted in everything we do. It has always been in our DNA. From the birth of Publicis, 94 years ago, when Marcel Bleustein-Blanchet, our founder, invented French advertising. Viva La Difference expresses how we value and respect each individual and recognize what makes us distinctive. This is the charge that inspires our teams to celebrate the differences in identity, background, culture, and experience of all of us. It is how we behave with each other and our clients, and it is deeply rooted throughout our work, to elevate and bring to life our differences throughout the platform world.

Overview

At Publicis Groupe, we believe in the power of data to transform how brands connect with people. Our Data Solutions team leads a Groupe-wide initiative focused on delivering best-in-class reporting and data solutions for some of the world‚Äôs most iconic brands. We work hand-in-hand with client teams, analysts, and tech specialists to build scalable, intelligent reporting frameworks that drive insight and action.

We‚Äôre now looking for a Data Analyst, Reporting & Operations to join our growing team and help bridge the gap between business and tech. If you thrive at the intersection of analytics, systems thinking, and client service‚Äîthis role is for you.

Responsibilities

As a Data Analyst, Reporting & Operations, you‚Äôll serve as the strategic link between client-facing teams and our technical developers‚Äîtranslating complex requirements into clear, deliverable solutions. Your focus will span data integrations, API connectors, reporting development, and dashboard functionality. Expect to lead projects end-to-end, working across teams to deliver smart, scalable, and elegant data solutions.

Client & Stakeholder Leadership


Be a trusted partner to internal client teams, ensuring expectations are met with clear timelines, technical support, and transparent communication
Lead regular check-ins to align on goals, capture feedback, and proactively surface new needs
Maintain a detailed understanding of project status and ensure best-in-class service delivery


Data Integration & Testing


Own the setup and maintenance of API connectors and automated reporting pipelines
Validate data quality, perform regression testing, and ensure KPI definitions match client narratives
Collaborate with technical teams to guarantee dashboard integrity and address any discrepancies


Reporting & Dashboard Development


Create dashboard wireframes, gather input from client teams, and translate into development-ready briefs
Oversee QA processes with Data Governance and the BI team
Coordinate testing, troubleshooting, and resolution of reporting issues
Safely manage data sharing with non-Publicis users in line with security standards


Qualifications

‚úî Experience in a data, operations, or analytics-focused role

‚úî Familiarity with BI and reporting platforms such as Power BI, Datorama, Data Studio, Databricks, SQL

‚úî Strong communication skills and a collaborative, solutions-focused mindset

‚úî An organised, proactive approach‚Äîcomfortable working across teams and timelines

‚úî Excitement for new technology, data storytelling, and digital marketing innovation

‚úî A team player who‚Äôs passionate about making data work harder, smarter, and more creatively

Benefits:

Additional information

In The UK, Alongside The Core Benefits Such As Pension, Life Assurance, Private Medical, And Income Protection Plan, We Also Offer:


WORK YOUR WORLD opportunity to work anywhere in the world, where there is a Publicis office, for up to 6 weeks a year.
REFLECTION DAYS - Two additional days of paid leave to step away from your usual day-to-day work and create time to focus on your well-being and self-care.
HELP@HAND BENEFITS 24/7 helpline to support you on a personal and professional level. Access to remote GPs, mental health support and CBT. Wellbeing content and lifestyle coaching.
FAMILY FRIENDLY POLICIES We provide 26 weeks of full pay for the following family milestones: Maternity. Adoption, Surrogacy and Shared Parental Leave.
FLEXIBLE WORKING, BANK HOLIDAY SWAP & BIRTHDAY DAY OFF You are entitled to an additional day off for your birthday, from your first day of employment.
GREAT LOCAL DISCOUNTS This includes membership discounts with Soho Friends, local restaurants and retailers in Westfield White City and Television Centre.


Publicis Groupe operates a hybrid working pattern with full time employees being office-based three days during the working week.

We are supportive of all candidates and are committed to providing a fair assessment process. If you have any circumstances (such as neurodiversity, physical or mental impairments or a medical condition) that may affect your assessment, please inform your Talent Acquisition Partner. We will discuss possible adjustments to ensure fairness. Rest assured, disclosing this information will not impact your treatment in our process.

Please make sure you check out the Publicis Career Page which showcases our Inclusive Benefits and our EAG‚Äôs (Employee Action Groups).

Benefits:

Additional information

In The UK, Alongside The Core Benefits Such As Pension, Life Assurance, Private Medical, And Income Protection Plan, We Also Offer:

  • WORK YOUR WORLD opportunity to work anywhere in the world, where there is a Publicis office, for up to 6 weeks a year.
  • REFLECTION DAYS - Two additional days of paid leave to step away from your usual day-to-day work and create time to focus on your well-being and self-care.
  • HELP@HAND BENEFITS 24/7 helpline to support you on a personal and professional level. Access to remote GPs, mental health support and CBT. Wellbeing content and lifestyle coaching.
  • FAMILY FRIENDLY POLICIES We provide 26 weeks of full pay for the following family milestones: Maternity. Adoption, Surrogacy and Shared Parental Leave.
  • FLEXIBLE WORKING, BANK HOLIDAY SWAP & BIRTHDAY DAY OFF You are entitled to an additional day off for your birthday, from your first day of employment.
  • GREAT LOCAL DISCOUNTS This includes membership discounts with Soho Friends, local restaurants and retailers in Westfield White City and Television Centre.

Publicis Groupe operates a hybrid working pattern with full time employees being office-based three days during the working week.

We are supportive of all candidates and are committed to providing a fair assessment process. If you have any circumstances (such as neurodiversity, physical or mental impairments or a medical condition) that may affect your assessment, please inform your Talent Acquisition Partner. We will discuss possible adjustments to ensure fairness. Rest assured, disclosing this information will not impact your treatment in our process.

Please make sure you check out the Publicis Career Page which showcases our Inclusive Benefits and our EAG‚Äôs (Employee Action Groups).

Title: TikTok LIVE Data Analyst
Description:
Responsibilities
The LIVE Operations team is obsessed with everything to do with TikTok LIVE. Our focus is to continually champion and optimize TikTok LIVE through working with creators to ensure a creative, fun and safe space for all of our users.

The Regional LIVE Operation Strategy Team leads various cross-functional projects. Our key initiatives include developing strategic plans to drive widespread adoption of LIVE at scale among creators, localizing new product features, creating user engagement strategies, ensuring a positive creator experience through education on the Community Guidelines and best practices, and providing ad hoc analysis and support to cross-functional partners.

Responsibilities:
- Analyzing local and global trends to help improve performance within the EU LIVE team
- Creating and preparing reports and dashboards to help us better identify areas of focus and trends within our ecosystem

Examples of Problems You'll Be Solving:
- What are the best content verticals for us to focus our creator recruitment on?
- Building a prediction model for identifying creators who may be destined for success on our platform
- Which metrics and leading and lagging indicators should we use for our key OKRs?
- How should we best segment our creators and users to have a more meaningful impact on their growth?
- What are the best touch-points to educate our creators, and when should we activate this education?
- Using statistical tools to simplify complex data sets, helping us better diagnose issues and propose solutions

Qualifications
Minimum Qualifications:
- Minimum 3 years of working experience in data analysis
- Strong mathematical skills to measure, collect, and analyze data
- Attention to detail

Preferred Qualifications:
- Proficiency in statistics and experience using data visualization software such as Tableau, PowerBI, or Looker
- Knowledge of SQL and any programming languages (Python is highly preferred)

About TikTok
TikTok is the leading destination for short-form mobile video. At TikTok, our mission is to inspire creativity and bring joy. TikTok's global headquarters are in Los Angeles and Singapore, and we also have offices in New York City, London, Dublin, Paris, Berlin, Dubai, Jakarta, Seoul, and Tokyo.‚Äã


Why Join Us
Inspiring creativity is at the core of TikTok's mission. Our innovative product is built to help people authentically express themselves, discover and connect ‚Äì and our global, diverse teams make that possible. Together, we create value for our communities, inspire creativity and bring joy - a mission we work towards every day.‚Äã
We strive to do great things with great people. We lead with curiosity, humility, and a desire to make impact in a rapidly growing tech company. Every challenge is an opportunity to learn and innovate as one team. We're resilient and embrace challenges as they come. By constantly iterating and fostering an "Always Day 1" mindset, we achieve meaningful breakthroughs for ourselves, our company, and our users. When we create and grow together, the possibilities are limitless. Join us.‚Äã
‚Äã
Diversity & Inclusion‚Äã
TikTok is committed to creating an inclusive space where employees are valued for their skills, experiences, and unique perspectives. Our platform connects people from across the globe and so does our workplace. At TikTok, our mission is to inspire creativity and bring joy. To achieve that goal, we are committed to celebrating our diverse voices and to creating an environment that reflects the many communities we reach. We are passionate about this and hope you are too.‚Äã

Title: Graduate Data Analyst
Description:
Ipsos Jarmany was founded in 2008 and is one of the UK‚Äôs fastest-growing data consultancy businesses, specialising in data visualisation. Our mission is to build a world-class organisation that helps businesses transform the way they manage and utilise data.

We provide a range of data services, including data strategy, platforms, visualisation and data science, to help our clients uncover the true story their data is telling them and enable them to make data-informed decisions to drive growth and business impact.

Our growing team of data analysts are at the cutting-edge of technology, using advanced analytics tools like Power BI, Google Cloud Platform and Microsoft Azure. We believe in empowering our people so they can become more confident, thrive and fulfil their potential, of course whilst having fun and learning new skills!

And, we‚Äôre on the hunt for new and ambitious talent‚Ä¶ fancy joining us?

About The Role

As a Graduate Data Analyst, you‚Äôll be working on major projects for globally recognised organisations. You will take on real-world problems for global clients, blending data analytics with strategic acumen from day one, whilst receiving continuous support and training to aid in your development.

At Ipsos Data Labs we place huge emphasis on the collection and structuring of information and utilise a variety of technologies to assist with the ETL process. You‚Äôll be responsible for designing and managing these automated systems and processes while helping to implement best practice throughout the organisation.

You‚Äôll have the opportunity to challenge yourself to fully utilise your capabilities, supporting our commercial teams in developing methods to present and explain complex analysis in a straight-forward, easy to understand way.

As part of this role, you will be enrolled in our graduate scheme which will support you through the first 18 months of your time at Ipsos Data Labs. The scheme will provide you with a structured programme, continuous mentorship, training and hands-on assignments to propel your understanding of data‚Äôs impact in the business landscape.

What we look for


A combination of technical capability and commercial acumen
Strong analytical skills combined with excellent communication and presentation skills needed to convey the analysis and insights to clients
Self-motivated individuals who thrive independently and, in a team, setting
Ambitious and driven individuals who want to be future leaders, take on responsibility and hold themselves accountable
Individuals who can apply technical insights derived from data to strategic thinking enabling businesses to achieve their desired objectives


Qualifications & Experience


Minimum 2:1 bachelor‚Äôs degree in a STEM subject
Ideally, an A Level in Math or Economics (Grade A / 7 or above preferable)
Programming experience is preferred but not essential


Skills you'll develop


Advanced Excel, Python and SQL Skills
Front-End Data Visualisation Development
Data-driven Commercial Storytelling
Marketing ROI and Digital Analytics Skills
Advanced Presentation Skills


A Typical Day...

Required

The role of our Data Analysts varies depending on the client and project they‚Äôve been assigned to, but typically you‚Äôll be required to:


Engage with extensive data sets using advanced data mining and predictive analytics techniques to uncover and communicate insights.
Design and optimise data processing systems to support data-driven decision-making processes.
Develop compelling data visualisations and dashboards that translate complex analyses into actionable strategies.
Foster collaborative relationships across teams to innovate and enhance commercial solutions.


Diversity and Inclusion

As an equal opportunities' employer, Ipsos Jarmany is committed to the equal treatment of all current and prospective employees and does not condone discrimination on the basis of age, disability, sex, sexual orientation, pregnancy and maternity, race or ethnicity, religion or belief, gender identity, or marriage and civil partnership. We aspire to have a diverse and inclusive workplace and strongly encourage suitably qualified applicants from a wide range of backgrounds to apply and join Ipsos Jarmany. We are also ‚ÄúDisability Confident Committed‚Äù to ensure we offer a recruitment process and working environment that is accessible to all candidates. Please let us know as soon as possible if you need any additional support so that we can make appropriate adjustments during the recruitment process.

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
Department: Data & Information

Location: Greenford (UB6 0HE) or Bow Road (E3 2SE) Campus - (On-site)

Type of Contract: Permanent

GBS is a higher education provider offering a range of sector-relevant courses across ten campuses in London, Birmingham, Leeds and Manchester. Working in partnership with several of the UK‚Äôs leading higher education providers, we deliver vocational, undergraduate and postgraduate programmes in finance, accounting, business, construction, tourism, healthcare, and more.

Our Vision: Changing lives through education.

What We Do: Developing and writing quality reports both internally for GBS and for GBS partner organisations and other external agencies. To contribute to preparations for degree awarding powers.

The role: Working with internal stakeholders, you will use your expertise to gather existing and/or new data (where identified) and undertake analysis to provide data insights across GBS. Applying appropriate analytical techniques, you will present your findings appropriately through written reports or through intuitive, self-serve dashboards that will empower colleagues to understand the key metrics that drive performance throughout the organisation.

Please note, we are unable to offer sponsorship for this position.

Main Responsibilities

What the role involves:


Work within a team to manage new data projects from end-to-end, gathering requirements through to developing and implementing new reports.
Engage with stakeholders to validate their requirements, review policies/procedures and present solution options in a manner that can be evaluated to meet needs.
Extract, prepare and collate raw data from multiple sources and provide analysing and manipulating data to produce customised reports and insights.
Lead and/or work within a team to design and implement surveys across the organisation, analysis of survey outcomes.
Analyse and interpret data to assist in providing solutions to deliver improved service delivery/performance and an optimal student experience.
Recognise erroneous data and escalate to the appropriate individual, in line with company procedures.
Monitor and assist in audits for data quality, data integrity and data governance.
Prepare reports for internal and external audiences using appropriate reporting tools, including Excel and Power BI.
Provide sector benchmarking through analysis of outcomes of NSS, TEF and Graduate Outcome Surveys.



Requirements

What Experience/Skills are required:


A good degree in a numerate subject
Prior use and understanding of Power BI or Tableau is essential.
Previous experience with data analysis.
Detailed knowledge of statistical techniques and research methodologies.
Experience in presenting data and providing insights via interactive dashboards or presentations.
Experience with R/Python/SPSS or SQL.
Confidence in building relations with internal and external stakeholders, with the ability to communicate complex data capability in a simple way.
Excellent knowledge of analytical tools, including Microsoft Power BI.
A good understanding of data and model design.



Desirable Experience:


Work experience in Higher Education or Public Sector.



Other Information

What We Offer


25 days annual leave, plus 8 public holidays
1-day extra leave per year of service, up to a maximum of 5 days
Workplace pension scheme
Tuition reimbursement for career development courses
Flexible Benefits: Cycle to Work, Workplace Nursery, Techscheme and much more
Perks@Work discounts platform, wellbeing centre and much more
Reward and recognition programme
¬£500 award employee referral scheme
Discretionary annual performance bonus



‚ÄúGBS has been a good place for professional growth. I have received great support from managers and colleagues who have encouraged me to develop new skills and take on more senior roles. Their mentorship has been invaluable to help me advance in my career.‚Äù

‚Äî Barbara Vargas (Professional Services Employee)

GBS is committed to equality, diversity and inclusion and providing a workplace free from discrimination or harassment. We welcome applications from all backgrounds and communities. We take our core values seriously and work hard to create an environment where everyone feels welcomed.

#indeedjune

Title: Junior Excel Analyst
Description:
Job Title: Excel Data Analyst

Location: London (Hybrid ‚Äì with global team collaboration)

Salary: up to ¬£45,000 + Benefits




Are you an Excel power user with a knack for automation and process improvement?

We‚Äôre hiring a proactive and technically skilled Excel Data Analyst to join a growing team within a high-performing, globally-connected Insurance services organisation.




This is a fantastic opportunity to modernise internal tooling and play a hands-on role in streamlining processes across international teams. You‚Äôll be a key player in evolving the way data is structured, analysed, and reported across the business.




What You‚Äôll Be Doing:

Data Analysis & Reporting

Clean, structure and analyse data from diverse sources
Apply statistical techniques to derive insights
Communicate findings to both technical and non-technical audiences
Conduct regular data quality checks and support data governance practices




Tooling & Automation

Build and maintain advanced Excel-based tools
Use macros and VBA to automate manual workflows
Assist in integrating tools with databases and external systems
Support ongoing Power BI dashboard development




Project & Process Support

Coordinate small internal projects and user requirements
Assist in writing user stories, test cases, and acceptance criteria
Apply structured problem-solving (e.g. pyramid principle, hypothesis-led design)
Deliver user training and documentation for tools developed

Tech Stack & Tools:

Advanced Microsoft Excel (including Macros and VBA)
Power BI (desirable)
SQL/database integration (advantageous)
Familiarity with data lake or cloud-based tools is a bonus




Ideal Candidate:

Strong Excel skills ‚Äì confident in macros, complex formulas, and VBA
A proactive problem-solver who enjoys driving process efficiencies
Excellent communicator, comfortable working across functions and regions
Organised, detail-oriented, and accountable for your own deliverables
Experience in financial services or insurance is a plus
Familiarity with Agile methodologies is helpful but not essential




What‚Äôs on Offer:

Competitive salary (¬£40‚Äì45K)
Hybrid working ‚Äì 2 days onsite in a central London location
A collaborative and values-led team culture
Exposure to global teams in Europe, Asia, and North America
Opportunities to shape and improve internal tools and workflows
A socially responsible business supporting causes globally through dedicated CSR efforts




Ready to make an impact with your Excel and automation skills?

APPLY NOW!!

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
Data Analyst | Nuclear Energy Innovation




üíº ¬£45,000‚Äì¬£55,000 + benefits | Hybrid ‚Äì London




We‚Äôre working with a pioneering nuclear energy company that‚Äôs transforming how low-carbon power is designed, delivered, and scaled across the UK. As they continue to grow, they‚Äôre looking for a skilled and curious Data Analyst to help drive smarter decisions across engineering, operations, and strategy.




This isn‚Äôt your typical analyst role ‚Äî it‚Äôs a chance to work at the intersection of energy, innovation, and impact. You‚Äôll be turning complex datasets into meaningful insights that shape everything from reactor performance to long-term infrastructure planning.




Why This Role Stands Out

‚úî Work on nationally significant clean energy projects

‚úî Join a purpose-driven business at the cutting edge of nuclear technology

‚úî Strong technical team with a collaborative, learning-focused culture

‚úî Hybrid working with flexible hours and career development support




What You‚Äôll Be Doing

Analysing operational and performance data from nuclear systems and infrastructure
Building dashboards, reports, and predictive models to inform business and engineering decisions
Working closely with engineers, scientists, and leadership teams to translate data into action
Supporting continuous improvement and regulatory reporting processes
Contributing to data strategy, governance, and tooling decisions as the team scales




What They‚Äôre Looking For

Strong experience in data analysis, ideally within engineering, energy, or regulated sectors
Proficient in SQL, Python (or R), and data visualisation tools like Power BI or Tableau
Comfortable working with complex datasets and extracting clear insights
Great communication skills ‚Äî able to explain technical findings to non-technical stakeholders
Passionate about using data to contribute to a cleaner energy future




If you‚Äôre looking for a meaningful role where your analysis directly supports the UK‚Äôs path to net zero ‚Äî this is it.




üì© Apply now or message me directly to find out more.

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
Job Title: Data Analyst (Social Media Focus)

Location: Southwark, London

Working Model: Hybrid

Salary: Up to ¬£42K




About Goat:

Goat is part of WPP Media (formerly GroupM), the world‚Äôs leading media investment company. Since 2015, we've been pioneers in influencer marketing, helping brands leverage the power of social media to achieve real, measurable results. Today, we stand as the global leader in the space, delivering award-winning campaigns across 70+ countries.




As part of our team, you'll collaborate with 500+ social natives worldwide, driving cutting-edge influencer campaigns for some of the most exciting brands. Whether it‚Äôs short-term activations or long-term ambassador programs, we treat influencer marketing as a full-funnel channel that drives awareness, engagement, and conversions.




Our data-driven approach is built on insights from tracking over 100,000 influencers and campaign performance. We combine this with expert relationship management, social-first creative strategy, paid media, and advanced tracking, measurement, and optimisation to deliver results that matter.




We‚Äôre also proud to be recognised as a recipient of the ‚ÄòTop Employer Europe 2024‚Äô certification, underscoring our commitment to fostering a dynamic and supportive work environment. If you‚Äôre ready to be part of the team shaping the industry, we‚Äôd love to hear from you.




Your responsibilities will include:

Collaborating with Paid and Organic Campaign teams to deliver data-led strategies that optimise performance, improve efficiency, and enhance targeting across live campaigns.
Extracting, cleaning and analysing large-scale social media datasets to uncover patterns, trends and actionable insights that inform campaign planning and decision-making.
Working cross-functionally with campaign managers, strategists and creative teams to embed data-driven thinking throughout campaign execution.
Working with the Campaign Data team to ensure accurate data capture, storage and retrieval, while supporting the evaluation and implementation of tools to improve data workflows.
Communicating complex data findings clearly and effectively to both technical and non-technical audiences, including internal stakeholders and clients.
Continuously monitoring campaign performance, using data to assess effectiveness and recommend opportunities for ongoing optimisation.
Producing clear, insightful reports and dashboards highlighting key trends, performance metrics and strategic recommendations.
Supporting audience development and strategic planning from a data-first perspective, using segmentation and behavioural analysis.




Required experience to apply:

Strong understanding of paid and organic social media, with an analytical mindset and a focus on performance.
Proven experience working with large datasets and translating findings into meaningful insights that inform strategy.
Excellent communication skills, with the ability to explain technical data and analysis in a simple, engaging way.
Minimum of 2 years‚Äô experience in a social media or digital marketing environment, with a focus on analytics and reporting.




Company Culture and Benefits:

Regular social events and ongoing clubs
Provided MacBook laptop to work from
Flexi-hours
Hybrid Working
¬£200 grant to make your working from home set up comfortable once you‚Äôve passed probation
Health and wellbeing allowance once you‚Äôve passed probation
Health Insurance after you‚Äôve passed probation
Life Insurance Policy
25 Days Holiday plus bank holidays, accruing up to 30 days based on length of service
Birthday & Work Anniversary Days Off
Length of Service Gifts
In-Office Benefits such as beauty treatments & yoga
Flexible Bank Holidays
Volunteering Days
Free Flu Jabs

Plus many more!
